2KgVhv9H-wCjeHUHKYaDyg.text: A friend took me here when I was in Scottsdale for work and he set the expectation in the car that this place was "a bit weird" and that "I might not like it", I went into it with low expectations and really no idea what to expect, a how bizarre could a sushi place really be. However, since he was the one driving and it was my second day in town, I didn't know anywhere we could go and was basically at his mercy so off we went.  That being said, once we pulled into the parking lot I got what he meant about "a bit weird", as the place was sandwiched in a corner of a strip mall that was more or less empty (we got there around 845). I was a bit apprehensive as we talked in, but the hostess seated us quickly and seated us in the back in a comfy booth that we requested. She patiently explained the menu and the specials and everything she mentioned sounded great. We settled on 4 rolls between the two of us, as well as some edamame and spring rolls and it was more than enough and we had plenty of leftovers. I couldn't speak to exactly what rolls we got (one with shrimp, one with eel and two others I'm blanking on), but I can tell you it was some of the best sushi I've ever had. Super fresh, made right in front of us and the chef came over to check on us and make sure that everything was how we wanted it.   The bill came out to around 60 between the two of us and we massively over ordered. 4 stars only being the ambiance is a bit weird and strip mall like, but worth it for the food. Wouldn't recommend it for a first date, but a good place for friends to catch up and enjoy some great sushi!

wcFIbONXgU5klwcxFLdjPw.text: UPDATE: Revising my review to 5 stars. Kept going again and again, great restaurant.   Original: I order the yellow curry as well and thought I was ordering Thai curry but was given Chinese curry or something else. I didn't like it but the owner refunded me the amount for that plate without me asking for that, so that was nice.

KzFYVcCU-Y5kIAFTZ5kqsg.text: We went here for dinner (It was Christmas night). Love that they have bike racks right outside the restaurant - we rode our bikes there on the greenbelt and it was super convenient. We were seated right away even though the hostess seemed unsure she could seat us since we didn't have reservations.  The service was friendly and efficient, but lacked basic things like silverware (we had to ask for it) and napkins (we also had to ask for them but they were never brought) The food was good and I honestly was skeptical of the different cuisines served (sushi, Chinese, Vietnamese, Thai) but my sushi was pretty good and my date's Kung Pao Chicken got a thumbs up. The pad thai and curry looked really good too and I couldn't decide between Thai and sushi -- sushi ended up winning.  Will be back for happy hour. Hoping that the subpar service was because it was a busy night. Next time I'll be trying the Thai!

J-uR7I8-1IJv5ENohtWE6A.text: Great place!! loved the Chicken Thai Pad plate lots of flavor mmm.... totally recommended.

lwBo2zkSn5ty0PqWmrsfKw.text: This place has been a huge and pleasant surprize. I pride myself in knowing what great asian food is, being I am half asian and I grew up on asian food every day, rice and kimchee lol!   This place has given me hope for asian restaurants that claim to be asian fusion. To me, they did it right. And even better!  This location offers EXTREMELY, perfectly executed AND authentic sushi, Vietnamese,  Thai AND Chinese dishes!!!! WHATT?!! :D  To top it off, the service is great, they offer many vegetarian dishes, AND ITS SO CUTE INSIDE! Prices are legit, and I couldint ask for anything more. So stoked that I found this place!!!

czzP9x0BNAi8edbWx3jPzQ.text: Stopped in for lunch and was surprised by how tasty everything was. Egg drop soup, Panang with shrimp, fried rice, Thai iced tea. Food coma time!

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YBOYJpNMu_X5Z8VHkBbzBg.text: Ordered totti's spring rolls (very crispy and delicious !) Panang curry and changmai noodle that were also so delicious (loved the deep coconut flavor and basil)  One mistake WE made - ordering Panang curry and changmai noodle together because their base curries were the same (I think) we wanted to try different dishes and share but we didnt know their base curries were going to be similar/same.  We will definitely come back to this place though !

1pLtwH2yCzPP2dByF8MnnA.text: I got the chicken pho with broccoli and spring rolls to go on a hungover Sunday night. I was a bit scared as the ratings for pho didn't seem that great and pho to go is always a let down. But it was one of the desperation things.   I was extremely pleasantly surprised. It was large enough for me to eat two meals from so that was nice. The flavor was delicious. The only complaint would be no jalapenos, but I had a fresh one at home so it worked out.   The receptionist, Paloma, was very nice and helpful while I waited. She deserves a raise for her hard work!

N5OH_dW9RA0gn0Q1mrIDgQ.text: Came here early Sunday to pick up a to-go order consisting of Beef Pho, Tottie Rolls and two soft drinks.  The Tottie Rolls:  The reason I added an extra star to this review. Decent sized, nice crispy outside and flavorful filling. The dipping sauce mint and lettuce added to the enjoyment although I think that the dipping sauce was slightly too sweet .  The  Beef Pho: Soggy overcooked noodles that were stuck together in a unappealing clump, thick chewy pieces of overcooked beef (it's supposed to come raw and very thinly sliced),no lime, small amounts of bean sprouts and flimsy, wilted garnishments and funky unpalatable broth. Can't believe they call this pho. It's not. I've had amazing pho from all over, even semi-amazing pho, and this place was very disappointing in comparison.  Soft Drinks: They didn't put them in our bag. $4+tax wasted. I should have checked to make sure they were there, but still annoying none the less.  $27 later and I'm still craving pho. Boo.

cF1qkmO73PVBaNDI3GPz9Q.text: The waitress was very friendly, great ventilation, wheelchair accessible. Thai selections on the bland side. Will not return.

IncT4nwBaCi4oFFLPIFMqQ.text: I can't believe I haven't written a review here yet!   I LOVE Tottie's. If you love curry and lemongrass and coconut and basil and everything good in this world, you will too.   -Their pad thai is insanely addicting. I get takeout all the time. Favorite drunk food by far. Let me tell you, I love spicy food, but you have to go easy on this. Like a 4 or a 5. Still spicy, but not overwhelming. -Got the shrimp panang because of the reviews, definitely recommend it.  -Tom Ka Gai was fantastic.  -Still have yet to try their pho or sushi, but I'm ecstatic that they serve such a variety of foods.   boom. Thank you Tottie's.

J3RScQF8sh_7mphx5DcXNA.text: This place is great. The quality of food is great and the portions are huge.  And our waitress Megan was awesome.  We recommend this place if you love any kind of oriental foods.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The lobby

XrQV4rM-gXDZB0AjYVrsaQ.text: I've been eating here for the pat few years. I found Tottie's by doing a search for  best asian food in scottsdale.  I have to agree. I've had asian food all over the world. New York, Europe, San Francisco.  This place is spectacular.  I love the panang chicken.  Highly highly recommend this place

XIuBTxDhn89MjJOJgTSSOg.text: Love totties they are consistently good at the Thomas location and a favorite place to take family and friends too.

P8UeP4zDDMWBAqIIFi6B9w.text: Don't get the pho here. It's not very good and they won't allow you to get the beef raw on the side so it was incredibly over cooked and chewy. :/

J3sP90p9ff4imvdINaMtzQ.text: We went to try out a new restaurant for our usual foodie Friday and decided Asian Fusion sounded different. Now we were a little worried when we saw it was in a strip mall but the reviews were good so we went in.   My coworkers chose something if the lunch menu. They chose the Kang Keo Wan at different spice levels. I tried #3 and it had a little kick and was very good. I actually ordered the Pho with beef and meatballs. It was delicious. I added more spice because I like it a little spicy and the broth was flavorful. I didn't really care for the meatballs but the beef strips were good.   Now there was an issue with my order and it took longer to come out. My coworkers started eating their meals while I waited. I didn't mind because Blake had already given me a free bowl of egg drop soup and apologized for the mishap. He also brought me some ice cream to take with me. He is very polite and professional so it was really not a big deal. We will definitely be back.

TStx12FpdoDv5oZI9O6YTw.text: Best curry I've had since I've been in AZ. Tottie rolls are awesome as well.  I ordered my food togo while waiting in the restaurant, and the server was extremely knowledgable. My food was based on her recommendations.... And I am extremely pleased. I will be back!!!

dh64I6ZgEpx-AuHJ5VH9Sw.text: Wasn't sure what to expect of a place in a strip mall near a 99 cent store... We were so pleasantly surprised! This place should be called Tastie's instead of Tottie's. Food was delicious and our waitress (Kelly) was awesome - attentive, informative and super nice. The inside has a nice ambience; great authentic feel. Definitely recommend the kang keo wan curry (chicken) and the Thai fried rice (chicken).

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great atmosphere! Feels authentic.

RzHNWT_9QhqdWoD93Os7RA.text: Very good Thai food. I came right at 11 and ordered the lunch Shrimp Pad Thai. For the price you really can't beat it...pad Thai with white rice egg roll and egg drop soup and a hot tea to drink for only $11.   There was plenty of left overs that will make my dinner tonight.

lDtOw3A4IuEswtoG00fNqg.text: Not a bad experience, but not amazing. We did Kung Pao chicken, sugarcane chicken, and egg rolls. Everything was a little more bland than the Asian style food we are used to.   Will be coming back to try some different dishes...

1mHvH6Ke_2mrmWPIV7U56A.text: After my brutally disappointing first Tottie's experience, I was convinced to give it another try.   My boyfriend had been raving about the green curry he tried while I was out of town. Even though I am normally a red curry fan, I decided to give it a try.  It was excellent!  There was a perfect amount of heat, coconut, veggies and tons of extra sauce! My only complaint is they gave us huge entree portions but a tiny little container of rice for use to share.  We've only dined take out, but when I picked it up, I was surprised that the dining room was nice and large despite its look from the curb.   I will be back!

vwO2Qj-VbNtdvBBFwDWieQ.text: It was fantastic!  I can't recommend it enough.  I was super excited that they have wonderful coconut ice cream on the menu in several different flavors.  My husband and I will definitely be going back just to get a chance to try the ice cream sampler.  The only issue will be resisting the urge to fill up on their other delicious food.

X4YCjzuYHqjhUC958jvLUA.text: What a great lunch!  And leftovers as well!  Wish it was closer to my house!

0-7jRk54XXZgND3F3bo8sw.text: I came here with an obscenely large group (more than 30) and they were way more accommodating with service than they had to be.  Everybody who wanted separate checks got separate checks and they even kept track of which small groups wanted their own group checks. Service was prompt considering how large our group was and water was quickly refilled throughout the evening.  I got the panang curry with chicken. It was reaalllly good. So much coconut milk, it was almost like candy. It doesn't taste like the panang curry I've had elsewhere, but I don't care if it was traditional or not. The sauce was dreamy, smooth, lick the bowl delicious.

Y7o8spS6eMIXAJFiRn17qA.text: Meh. Boyfriend and I shared the Tottie Rolls (good, but definitely not "the best egg rolls you'll ever have), Shrimp Tom Yum (tasty, but doesn't hold a candle to the soup at Malee's), Queen Alaskan Roll (tried it because it was the daily special, but did not enjoy it), and the General Tao's chicken (just ok). Everything on the menu - Thai, Vietnamese, Japanese and Chinese dishes - sounded good, but it just didn't blow us away in the taste department. The restaurant's atmosphere was nice, and the waiter was excellent and very attentive. Probably the best part of the meal was the iced green tea - it was very flavorful.

TXJvMrScGR5hJfiLDJj7Og.text: Amazing food, great prices, friendly staff, and a great selection.  What more can you ask for?  I love the mandarin chicken and the homemade ice cream.  Asian Fusion at its best.

UNLKxdmNWkoLNEAnhlWmaw.text: I've been to Totties 5 or 6 times for dinner and i always enjoyed it. The Tuna Crunch Roll is really good and so is the Buba Gump Roll.  Their Thai food is also pretty good and their Tom Kha has a nice thick broth.The reason I only gave it 4 stars is because of the actual service. The one time I went for lunch they didn't have any of the dishes I asked for and the service both at dinner and at lunch is always lacking. Maybe the day i went in for lunch there was a problem in the kitchen or something but they could have told us that when we walked in. Again, the waitresses are ok but you have to flag them down for drink refills and they take their time getting your food to your table.But aside from that I would recommend dinner at Totties

4M69ePxtwnBgyx6b7_02bQ.text: This place is EXTREMELY hit or miss. My date and I went after always smelling the greatness on our way to volleyball, and were both disgusted by our meals. Do NOT purchase the beef and zucchini or shrimp Panang. Both are not worth feeding to a rat. The crab rolls as an appetizer should just be thrown in the trash.... So terrible and basically stuffing your face with mint and a skin-like wrapper. Our friends even recommend certain dishes, but agree you can definitely go wrong at this place. I have been told to try the Pad Thai. Be weary of everything else.

uXenAQnXCgwSxnNHShFjIw.text: The atmosphere is much more elegant inside than it seemed from the outside. Chicken Thai and Egg Drop soup for two (huge) was awesome. Definitely a reasonable price too. I THINK I have had someone grab me carry-out Sweet and Sour Pork from here before and I wasnt a huge fan of the dish. Dining in is the way to go!

8Q0Xka3hgerP6EbUz_J-4g.text: Totties is just about one of the best restaurants  I have been to lately.  I am reasonably certain that all their food is good but I probably will never know as the only two items I get EVERY time I go are their spring rolls and their Beef Pho Tai soup!  It is that good!  The spring rolls have chunks of pork and fresh shrimp and are laced throughout with cilantro and rice.  They are amazing.  My boyfriend and I douse them thoroughly in their delicious peanut sauce that we doctor up with soy sauce, plum sance and a spicy red sauce.     Then we have the Pho Tai which seriously even  if I was a step away from death and sick with a cold I would still  drive to Totties to have instead of that crappy Campbells Chicken Noodle Soup.    The owner (Tottie- go figure!) told me that she makes the beef broth with beef marrow which sounds really gross until you have it.  There is an undescribable seasoning (marrow?) in the soup that is just delicious.   And that is another dish that you doctor right up- add a little bean sprouts, fresh mint, fresh cilantro, leetle bit of peanut sauce, soy sauce and you are done.  We practically want to scrape the bowl clean.  Being from Scottsdale and watching my girlish figure, it is pretty embarrassing that I am practically jabbing the boyfriend to get to the soup!  So that is it!  The new location is beautiful and I hope that they have great success there as it has more panache than their first location.  Yum!

GPFzv4yc2dRpd5s6AePbqg.text: A family dinner tradition! My family is from San Francisco but when they come into town I always take them to Tottie's because its always delicious and authentic.  We usually get the Spring Rolls, a curry, and AVOCADO ice cream.  Always good service, I've gotten take out a couple times and once I ordered wrong and they corrected my mistake without charging me :) Definitely go.

BDbgTKHTxgGR7zYoF4BGEQ.text: as most people have noted here, tottie's is not asian fusion in the traditional definition of fusion cuisine. its dishes don't combine different cuisines into one experimental dish. tottie's offers chinese, viet, thai and sushi, but as separate dishes. but if you end up ordering a dish from each separate cuisine, you end up with a pan-asian meal. so in that sense, it's a meal fused from different cultures.  i recommend this place if you're with a group of people who all want different things and can't decide on a specific asian cuisine. tottie's does each cuisine fine, though not spectacular. i would say that in each cuisine, tottie's is better than most places in phoenix that do just thai, or sushi, etc.   the sushi fish was fresh, and the rolls were a good size. the thai curries are big enough for two, and they don't charge extra for rice (which is nice). the waitstaff is very nice.   this place is a solid good eatery. i can't give it 4 stars because i feel if it concentrated on one cuisine, it could excel and be at the top of that cuisine. but i also wouldn't change much of anything here (except maybe they should take down the outdated shanghai gourmet reviews in the windows -- very misleading).

jL7q70evEAw5DZoE0WJhgQ.text: It's hard to find an authentic place to eat these days. The ambiance, decor, and food were just that. Everything we had was delicious (and unique, to us at least) from the Larb, to the spicy pickled cucumbers. The Pad Thai was wonderful as well. Our favorite by far, however, and large enough to feed 2-4 people alone was the Seafood Soup. The flavors were powerful and delectable. We were full for like two days, haha. Great service too. We went at 5pm on a Sat. night and we basically had the place to ourselves. It was very busy by 7pm. When we're back in that area, there is no doubt we will go there again!  Not expensive, very reasonably priced, ESPECIALLY considering how much food we had (and had left over). Reservations recommended.

1vI9zDHa9oOTwBJcdb8mFg.text: I gotta say, I might be the only one, but I just wasn't that blown away with this place.  Having just moved to the area, I was very excited to find out we had a sushi joint within a mile of our home.  I was even more excited when I read the other reviews on here.  Of course, no one reviewed the sushi yet.  We has been in the pool all day and were looking for something that we could bring back home.  We stopped in, grabbed a sushi menu and headed for the waiting area framed by this amazing crystal dragon.  We spent about 5 minutes just discussing this dragon and how much we wanted to touch it but were sure we would ruin it and the Tottie's SWAT would come looking for us.  After reviewing the menu I noticed that the selection was much smaller than some other places.  We opted for 4 rolls and salmon nigiri.  We waited around for awhile and I think the hostesses forgot about us because they finally walked back to check on someone else, saw me and said Oh!  You're sushi is ready at the front.  We grab it, pay $42 and head home - less than 2 minutes.  I get home to see that the sushi is small - smaller than what you get at the grocery store with very very little actual fish in it.  The avocado was turning slightly brown (probably from the wait up front) and it just didn't make me say Wow at all.  We ate it (well, most of it) because we were hungry but I have to say I don't think I will be getting sushi from there again.  Maybe it was an off night, I just wouldn't recommend it.  Expecially not for that price.  I would have been better going off to Ra.    However, its cute inside and I like the crystal dragon so they get 2 stars.  Maybe I'll go back sometime and try some of the other food people are raving about.

IezkX-znVuMZyizuXJds8g.text: Great Food, Great Selection.  They have a little bit of everything asian.  Tasted the shushi, was OK.  The Pho soup is good and the thai curries are great.  Give it 3.5 Stars.

RaF9JVSHmLuAu-1xfKMxig.text: Five stars for those amazing Tottie rolls!  I love coming by just for these.

4q92VEWO21OWEZvGGrpxjg.text: Great place! The Chirashi was awesome, as was all the sushi we tried (5 stars for actually having Chirashi on the menu). Definitely one of the best sushi joints in town.

8V1aQKHOEMWnQbqAzjqQbQ.text: It was our first time trying out Asian Fusion. I was delighted with the decoration on the walls. The servers was good and really attentive. The food was tasty and good portion. There was a wide variety of cuisines on the menu, so lots of choices! We liked it a lot ;)

TGsER7_ebaIlU6ZNtKvPVg.text: I love this place.  It's not a trendy Scottsdale place - just great quality and value food.  They've even added brown rice to the offerings after years of harrassment from yours truly :-)  The lunch specials are great for a business lunch - though they can get busy now.  Also a new Happy Hour (three of them really): 4-7pm.  I agree service quality does tend to vary but it's part of a small business growing.  I am usually with people I want to talk with so it's never an issue.  I am glad we have an asset like this place in the neighborhood and never get sick of trying out the menu (which BTW you aren't limited to if you're open to Tottie's suggestions!).

gr6bKtu4xjy4T5REmr5jTA.text: Had the softshell crab curry and it was the best curry I ever had.  Great environment, service as well.

L1RGYLRwpeJ2krN-kxxyyA.text: Their food is great but their front door staff & waiters suck. Totties has forgotten the fact there are many other very good Asian fusion cuisine spots in scottsdale & Phoenix these days. They can't afford to continue to survive off the vapors of previous success. I predict they'll be out of business within a year due to this horrible service. People won't stand for it.

WJfRYH_3h0sUUEJ67X5Hyw.text: I have gone to this place many times over the years and never had a bad experience until today. I always ask for "No MSG" because I am highly allergic. Today my waitress forgot to tell the kitchen about the MSG and I got very ill after eating. I mean so ill that I almost had to call the ambulance! Very bad! And the service was also very slow. I am done with Tottie's!

DyaZ3aT7dr6uv9ig6L-zpQ.text: We've gone to Tottie's several times and always had a good experience. They have a lot to chose from. I've always found the service to be great and the staff friendly. I'll be back!

0caG8WZ_E4P4cIyML4t8Fg.text: This is probably the most diverse restaurant that I've been to, with a wide variety of cuisines. Ranging from Chinese to Japanese, you won't be disappointed with this restaurant. Good serving sizes and nice service.

1QtvEYuWIxxCoD1jx0QP2w.text: The food was not good at all.  Both my mother and I left most of our food on the plate.  The waitress did not inquire whether we enjoyed food or if there were any problems. Would never return.

PtrIkVDAU__3xJ_Gp9ITpw.text: I get that they are "Asian Fusion" but I think they should specialize in one type, because I feel that the food is just OKAY. And I'm paying to eat in SOUTH Scottsdale.

1MWH9eoablHMYvB0AHnmIA.text: I came here to grab lunch based on the reviews and was disappointed!  Service: The service was so slow despite the fact there wasn't much customers in the restaurant.  After sitting for a long while, one of staff finally said it took so long because they were taking care of catering order instead of getting our main food out.  Food: We started off with spring rolls and it was not great.  The wrapper was hard and sauce was not your traditional spring roll sauce.  The egg rolls was also burnt on the outside and wasn't that great either.  I also ordered Tom yum soup and the flavor was totally off.  It was dark, heavy and was salty.  It did not taste like any other Thai Tom yum soup.  The curry was just ok compared to other Thai restaurant and a bit more sweeter.  As far as the pho noodle, it was definitely off nothing like your traditional pho restaurant.  The flavor is strange and noodle were bit hard.  The siracha and hoison sauce were not served from bottle instead it was poured into small ramekins. Lastly, we also ordered Chiangmai noodle, the noodle was hard and the sauce especially was really off.  It was way too thick, salty and to kill the taste we had to add spice but still was not good.  This is my last visit here!! If you want authentic Thai food or any other fusion of ASIAN food, I would recommend elsewhere!

4jmOOM4LLf_I6P1TvVbABw.text: Thank you Tottie and staff for creating a fantastic dining experience for us. Your chef tasting courses was a treat for the senses. Everything was so delicious.
