oaUpw8CkOE6S1P7ZJz_hOg.text: I don't understand how it's possible for anybody to give this place a good review.   An entre room full of people all found every single item ordered to be absolutely inedible. And most of then were drunk and starving.  They weren't even difficult dishes.  One person described the spring rolls as garbage wrapped in a condom... A fitting description.  The shrimp tempura was the closest thing to edible that arrived and yet was still over cooked and the worst I've ever had. It's hard to mess up fried rice and yet they managed to do so.   The shrimp Rangoon  sounded like a surefire win and I don't know how it's possible but they added whatever it took to ruin deep fried shrimp and cream cheese.    This place was SHOCKINGLY bad. If you enjoy their food I bet my life you never tasted anything that you didn't fully enjoy even if I was from the cats food dish when you were three.

HrcEKXmAxYD2b3gVNwiUlA.text: Lovely shopping center restaurant. 0ne page menu includes classic Thai dishes. Advertises as serving Vietnamese but didn't see any of that type if food that I recognized. Also Asian dishes. Staff attentive. Not sure of the heat level in green and red curry. I was brought a sample of each to try. My waitress recommended level 2, it was perfect! I also had lychee infused sake, worth visiting for that. I choose Pad Khing: ginger,  mushrooms and onions with chicken. Very tasty, for me would have liked more ginger. I will be back.

ocM9szLHy221TJ1olEtuPg.text: I have only ordered take out from Totties. The fois is always fresh, always great, but sometimes they forget things and they have recently raised their prices. I eaten here many times in the last 2-3 years and will continue to do so.

kCaDometrhbNy1lTwpn7TA.text: Pros:  - atmosphere is nice  - service is great - delicious hot and sour soup - good lunch prices  Cons:  - the panang curry was very bland and didn't really taste like panang to be honest - tasted like a Chinese stir fry - 6/7 spicy was not spicy at all  - no Thai chilies in the dish - seemed like a chili base instead of coconut milk - flavor profile didn't match authentic curry (no coconut milk, fish oil, or lemongrass)  Overall:  A nice place to go eat for Chinese food I would think.  Not good for Thai food.  If you want Thai food I would go to a place that primarily serves it. Hard to serve Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, and sushi and do them all justice.

Mdy7z6ssJkie3PCFkYMivA.text: Your standard Asian/Chinese cuisine, delicious and big portions. I got the Kung Pao Chicken. Exactly what I expected though it's flavor was a shade different than usual. If you're looking for cheap but quality Asian, look no further.

rUPphs_67u8J8e4Wv30e4w.text: I'll give it 3 stars with a willingness to visit again and exercise an option on a 4th star.  Friendly efficient service executed in the comfort of the prototypical and stereotypical strip mall setting.  I ordered the Pad Thai, one of my Asian barometers, and it fit in the middle of my bell curve.  Not exceptional but pretty good. The egg rolls were solid.  There were some other interesting items on the menu that definitely merit a  couple of additional visits in hopes that this can become part of the regular area rotation.   I am in  the market of a 'go-to' spot for Asian.

gEkPuLrnCOpg0CJ3vYNymw.text: I found this place on Yelp when my mom was in town visiting and we wanted Thai food.  They are located right next to the CVS and there is usually plenty of parking. All the times I have been there, there had never been a wait and they are never too busy which is nice. They have a pretty large menu with all different kinds of food: Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, etc.  I've only ever ordered off the Thai menu, but it has been very good.  My mom and I got a few dishes to split and the portions were huge. We took home plenty of left overs.    We order the Panang and the seafood curry. Both were delicious and had great flavor. My mom isn't a huge fan of spice, so we got the dishes at medium and sometimes they can be bland but they had all the flavor and none of the heat.  I've also ordered the Pad Thai and the Pad Se Ew and they were both great dishes as well. The dishes tend to be very traditional and the staff is very attentive.

8ktsf24PHPYaP9kywn06xw.text: I really like this place a lot my bf introduced me to this place and I really like the service here as well as the selections on the menu always trying something new. Plus its close to where we live :) Fresh food and again the service is amazing

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Stir fry yum

aIb90X5p6EHxGfq6cMrp-w.text: I used to come here a lot, it was my favorite Asian place in Scottsdale. Today was horrible the service was very very slow. We waited a long time to order food, then to receive our food then to get our check. I ordered my usually favorite which was the Kung pao beef. The peanuts tasted spoiled and the beef was sour. Just the whole experience was so disapointing.

ICCd3NrZCRkm03TWD3NDFg.text: Do not recommend. Came here the other day on a lunch break & ordered the vegetable panang curry. Fast forward 5 hours later I had terrible food poisoning. I would not recommend coming here.

-o9E7FdEhQKQX8L171lueg.text: Fast service and decorative interior. My wife and I both had the panag curry so we can't be too spacific, but it was decent.  Not the best I've had.

DfHnsLGRh9X8EF4UW-i5jw.text: Some of the best panang curry that I have had in the valley! Everything on the menu that I've had has been great. Excellent service too!  Can't wait to go back!

51LTJAKg-bP3sLjhVyPhsQ.text: I wish there was a half star more I could give Tottie because it is really my favorite place for Chinese or Thai (haven't tried the sushi) but there have been one or two slip ups on the part of the staff. Aside from that, Tottie, I love you long time!  Good, dark and elegant place for a date, or affair, Tottie, and you could make a great meal from just the appetizers. Order a Pu Pu. Huh-huh!   The Tottie Rolls, with sauce and lettuce wrap are great and if you're lucky and it's late, Tottie will prepare them for you and feed them to you while her womanly chest heaves with desire, using food as one would join in human sexual desire. But I digress.  All the dishes are terrific but I wish the Pad Thai was not as mushy. If you do have any complaints, Tottie is always the lady and restaurateur and will treat your complaint with patience and kindness or perhaps a spanking and some rough stuff before she forces your head into the plate of Pad Thai by lying prone on your back, squirting that Scrimshaw sauce, or whatever they call it, into your nasal cavity and belittling you in Chinese because you've been a naughty, naughty boy. But I digress  For dessert, I highly recommend the coconut ice cream with fried honey bananas. Your banana will be surprisingly hot and Tottie likes it that way. That's how she serves the bananas in her place.  I didn't care for the incredible wait at the Paradise Valley location, but hopefully Tottie will have more openings for us all. But I digress.

rPLACL1XrJabTkRP1HDnbg.text: I ordered mild, but the food still had quite a kick.  With that being said, I enjoyed the food.  A rather large group of us went in at lunch time and were seated quickly and served just as fast.  Most of us ate from their weekday lunch special (about $8 per plate).  The lunch special comes with soup and an egg roll.  The ambiance is nice.  Like a few other reviewers have suggested, you can't really guess what you're getting into from the strip mall appearance outside.  Our waiter was nice and attentive.  He walked the fine line between participating in our group conversation and being creepy really well.  There are a few Thai places in this area, and Tottie's is one of the better.

6xOp4LE7I5kJvUOsM-Vtfw.text: Fusion?  I don't think so. Its a Pan-Asian - Pacific Rim place...  Is it the best thai?...no but its good Is it the best chinese?...no but its good is it the best vietnamese?...no but its ok Is it the best sushi?...no but its ok  it has nice decor, above average food, great selection, typical asian service standards.  its good if your party can't decide on any specific type of asian cuisine

diZ8WhTOCPYlBcGVJlFzGg.text: Went with friends and found the whole experience enjoyable. Great atmosphere  and loved the food. Rarely get to combine Chinese, Thai and Japanese. Next time I'll try the Vietnamese. Great lettuce wrapped spring rolls, all the home made ice creams made with coconut milk...

b9k6oFlhHEFA80NP4RscNQ.text: Went to Totties being Noodles Ranch is closed Sundays. The tom kha gai was really good at a spice number 7. She laughed on the phone hearing a white boy order something so spicy. The ambiance inside is really interesting as well. I'm definitely looking forward to trying their pho there next time!

eLDgPbJpv0LI_wtvU__0ZQ.text: Came her on a date night that included a nauseous tummy... and I left with a satisfied belly and resolution to return!  We ate family-style, and I had the privilege to enjoy the Tom Ka Gai, Green Papaya Salad, and Chicken Panang.   The waitress was accommodating, funny, and seemingly sincere with her candor. Once the Tom Ka Gai came out, and the delicious broth filled my mouth, I am pretty sure my body went into some kind of shock - there was nothing else going on in the world, except the flavor explosion in my mouth!   It was spicy, yet creamy, and FLAVORFUL! I still frequently fantasize about this soup. The chicken wasn't sparse, and I am actually drooling, just thinking about it.  The Panang and Green Papaya were equally delicious. Not to the Tom Ka Gai (the obsession is truly an unhealthy one), but to each other. It depends on what you're in the mood for... But the Panang sauce combined with chicken and rice made for a delicious meal, and even a not-so-guilt-free breakfast the next day. The Green Papaya Salad was served with grilled chicken and sticky rice. The cool salad was crispy and combined well with the chargrilled chicken.  I can't wait to try more, and hope you enjoy it, if you try (Tom Ka Gai) anything on the menu! I am positive you'll find anything there enjoyable. There is a wide variety of Pan Asian cuisine to delight your tastebuds.

kwBVmD8rEbPFZzQuLMrPzA.text: I eat here about once a month and stick to the usual--chicken pad thai, panang chicken, spring rolls and occasionally pho tai soup(it cures what ails). I have sampled off other dishes and have never been disappointed.  Trying other thai restaurants I always find myself returning to Totties. The portions are good and the food is consistently delicious. And the mango ice cream is a good way to end the meal.

JcrvzsrtgVdrctlBwhIiHQ.text: Great location, good egg rolls, bad service.  We were asked how spicy on a scale of 7 and were told that 3 is mild. I got a 3 and my friend a 4.  Both dishes were so hot and spicy, we couldn't eat!  The waitress noticed and didn't offer anything until she brought our check and by then , we just wanted to leave.  Also, when waitress brought my friend her drink, the waitress commented, "it's good! I know, I tried it!" guess that explains everything.  She did seem a bit too "happy".  Will not return.

ni-8ySvpZHsfEhE4yiFNkg.text: Tottie's has a large dinner menu, but they only offer a portion of that menu for lunch specials.  The lunch menu has rotated over the 8 years I have been going to Tottie's.  They have traditionally allowed regular menu items as lunch specials when not listed, especially when they were offered as lunch specials in the past.  Like I said, over eight years I have seen several lunch menus.  Today, I asked for the Sesame Chicken (my favorite) and was told that could not be offered as a lunch special, only as a full-priced dinner item.  My next lunch menu option was not what I expected and I was disappointed (cashew chicken).  With the multitude of restaurants in the area, I need to find another Asian Food location for the future.  Any suggestions?

tTH0vu0DSYJn4W1UGzP7dw.text: It's ok. Nothing that would blow your mind. Just a normal asian fusion restaurant.

YVrXelAsktPkowkQCJAitw.text: Date night turned into stuffed belly night! This was such great food! We started of with Tom Ka Gai that was flavorgasmic! Then moved onto Papaya salad and Chicken Panang. We couldn't finish 1/2 the entree but made for GREAT left overs! The service was wonderful. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum!

Kqvp7n4Q7B0InwE4yR5fCA.text: I'm heating up the leftovers as I type. This place is amazing.  My experience here was as good as it gets. The atmosphere is great with folded cloth napkins, big LCD TV's, and spacious booths. The service was fantastic. Our server actually asked me if I wanted to have a "to go" cup of this special hot sauce they make. Hell yeah I would.  The prices are reasonable and the portions are great. Georgeann G and I enjoyed the Singapore Noodles (angel hair, shrimp, and pork in a curry sauce) and the Yum Gai (spicy minced beef served cool over a salad of vegetables). Both dishes were amazing and the special hot sauce our server suggested was a great compliment to the already vibrant flavors.   I wish I would have caught our servers name because he was really a master of his craft.   This is definitely a place to check out if you haven't already.

5Gcx00TNbXRXEzuOXtpPBQ.text: Because I live within walking distance, I end up eating here frequently--almost every week. Service is usually pretty good, although the last time I went and brought friends our waitress was all over the place and we waited a long time for our food. But hey, 1 out of 10 times or so isn't that bad. Plus, the staff knows the menu pretty well and they make really good recommendations.   The Thai portion of the menu is the best and definitely comes with the most food. I like the Kang Keo Wang: a mix of chicken (you choose which meat) and vegetables in a delicious green curry sauce., and the Chiang Mai Noodles--similar to the Kang Keo Wan but has more of a coconut taste to it. They also let you choose your spice level:1-10. 4 is about the spiciness of a jalapeno. You can also ask them to cut down on the sugar, if you feel like being healthy.

4MjgckVTWSFGYkRVwKuUxA.text: Sweet baby Jesus!! I was here this past Saturday with the lovely Miss Jill C. We wanted to do our annual picnic but alas the weather was acting funny so we decided to head over for some yummy Thai food since that is what I was currently craving.  It was pretty empty for a Saturday afternoon, but then again they do not offer the lunch specials I have heard so much about on the weekends and sushi is not available until 6pm. Sad to say the least, but it did not deter us. We ordered some veggie spring rolls to share and after looking over the menu, can you believe all I ended up ordering was Pad Thai? Sad but that is what I really wanted. Jill ordered a yummy curry dish that had me wishing I had ordered some Panang but no worries as there will be a next time. OMG! The portions were HUGE. From the biggest veggie spring rolls I have ever seen to the massive portion of Pad Thai. I was in food heaven. Of course after a few bites I was like ok, time to wrap it up because I just couldn't eat anymore, but let me just say that the next day, my leftovers were spectacular. Especially since I had my Pad Thai extra, extra, extra spicy. Yummy indeed. Of course we washed it all down with some yummy Thai iced tea. I mean with all that spice, you need something cool to help soothe your tongue right.  I will definitely try to make it to one of the locations for their lunchtime special but in the meantime, if you are craving some Thai, definitely check this place out. You will not be disappointed.

9TzM6jimKFayLAnJpXTdgA.text: This is some great Asian Food! I first discovered Tottie's because it was in a shopping center right behind my old house, my roommates gave it a try and were big fans. After that I tried it, and I'm now a big fan.   The food is a little bit of everything Asian. Thai is their specialty, but everything on the menu is good. Actually, my only complaint is that the menu is way too big. It's way too hard to decide what you want.   I really love the Pad Thai. If you're not into hot food, watch out.  We had it medium and it still had a good kick (medium was not my choice, I would've gone for more heat).  For an appetizer I highly recommend the Vietnamese spring rolls (with an amazing peanut sauce). I also highly recommend the Tottie Rolls. It's a fried pork roll with a lettuce wrap and mint leaves.  The menu says they're the best rolls you ever had. They may be right!

MeIjRbSv4lGW5AAXYUYxcw.text: After reading about Tottie's in the Phoenix mag, we wanted to see what the hype was about.  The atmosphere is very nice, charming decor and interesting paintings on the wall.  We ordered chicken panang (medium hot), spicy tuna sushi and Totti'es egg rolls.    The panang was flavorful and just the right amount of heat.  There was no way I could finish the large bowl it was served in.  The egg rolls were fresh and most tasty wrapped in the lettuce with a sprig of mint.  The sushi was fine but nothing over the top.    If you want sushi, go to a sushi bar.  Overall, a pleasant and tasty meal.  At least you can have conversation and not have to yell.

QX1NBpRkiJloqmrlBUF8lQ.text: We ordered the Sugercane chicken and the meal comes out with a vegetable plate and a little grill that you throw the Chicken on. This is a fun experience for $10. We also had the Seafood Tum yum soup and it came out like a hot pot but It wasn't that good like I had expected it to be better for $13. It was quite bitter. Ambience was nice though and our waiter B was amazing. He checked on us all the time to make sure we were ok. That is why they deserve a 4 star.

UbbT9vv6aPqeVoKMIB8gDw.text: Probably my own fault as I was on a Vegetarian kick when I went in. I'm sure next time will be incredible, the food my date had looked delish!

imzJsgVj6ZeaBuc1vwR9TQ.text: Fast and courteous service. Awesome flavored food. Perfect temperature food and drinks. Great prices.   Never have I gotten this lucky on a first try of any restaurant. Highly recomended!

_f2Mes5zxaLzhKHDwJjpkA.text: Totties is great, they have some of the best food I've ever had. I love the sushi as well. I ordered the channel made but instead of chicken and shrimp I ask for a muscles instead and it's amazing! I could eat this everyday!

GXzKGiZKXeikI-s4ADcd8A.text: A little bit on the pricey side but I love this place! I always get the chicken pad Thai!

_Js_NKBf-0Uz6QHLYf9xzg.text: I'm up in the air about Tottie's. My partner and dined there Saturday night with much anticipation. Unfortunately we were somewhat let down.   We had eaten here previously when it was Shanghai Palace and the food and service were exceptional. Now that they've expanded they need to do some work to get their act together.   Our server was nice, but way overworked. Being very hungry we ordered and appetizer right away and were promptly informed it would take 15 minutes. That was okay and we were willing to wait. When 15 minutes turned into almost 45 minutes we weren't very happy.   After mentioning something to our server everything miraculously appeared. It was almost as if they were throwing the food at us. Again, it wasn't our servers fault she was helping out two people who had just started.   All in all the food was very good and I would have given it four-five stars if the service had been better. There's a wide variety of very good Asian food so don't hesitate to try Tottie's, just about anyone can find something to please their palate.   We will give Tottie's another try too, we just hope they can get their house in order to make for a more pleasant dining experience.

W1dn4DKFwLFGQDgziw_gYw.text: I could literally eat here everyday. The only downside is that sushi isn't always available, but the quick service, perfectly cooked rice, mouthwatering sauces, and great selection in different cuisines makes up for it by far. And I prefer places that will wait for their sushi guy to come in at night to make a perfectly balanced and delicious roll!

P7wzWZb01kG-CW2B02fgxA.text: Just ordered carry-out while at work and was pleasantly surprised. The one thing I would say is definitely order the lunch portion. The dinner portions are massive! The vegetables are very fresh and not over cooked. The carry-out service was accommodating (split the bill for each person's order). When we opened the bags we were surprised to see that they individually wrapped each entree in a separate bag to avoid spilling. The entrees were flavorful, but not overpowering. Will definitely return and be more daring on my selection.

As6gVGMxcYaSZMrxaSuqUw.text: Love this place, great Thai food. We ordered Panang, Egg Rolls, Thai Fried Rice and Pad Thai. Everything was amazing except the Pad Thai. They use really thin noodles, which I've not seen before. It wasn't my favorite, but everything else was delicious. I would definitely go back!

GQGoG7YidoEZ0Vjytz1dxA.text: Solid.  Had the Thai stir-fry, and requested fresh ginger, met exact expectations

xoL_mWP-P_81tfWMDTeF4g.text: Heard about this place from friends. Was excited to try it. Not really impressed. Food was just flavorful enough to not be bad. Meh....egg rolls were mushy inside. Sugarcane chicken was ok.

vxzJSaiJIKgaDPnhGuibeA.text: We have dinner here all the time.  We've always had wonderful dishes.  This is one of those great neighborhood gems that had an exceptional chef.  The menu is big and filled with authentic dishes.  I love this place. The interior is nice and the artwork is lovely.

90gzsH9Iik54ZdBTa8bXsw.text: Totties is by far my favorite Asian restaurant! I don't typically dine-in as I'm not crazy about the inside. The Totties Fried Rice is out of this world! It is a little overpriced, but definitely worth it!

iHNDqOOkDYV6j9vy2XNwrw.text: The egg drop soup is the best I have ever had. The Tottie rolls are also amazing. I am never disappointed when we eat here.

BrLE-wXVinjL7_1F_bDxRw.text: This place was highly recommended to me by a co-worker.  I decided to order a lunch special for takeout, which consisted of fried rice and vegetable chow mein.   Since I ordered the food to go, they wanted an extra dollar for the soup that is included with their lunch specials...WTF(?)  When I arrived to pick up my food, it took nearly 5 minutes to be acknowledged, and no, they were not busy.  And when I paid, I was charged $6.50 instead of the $5.95 that is listed on their online menu.  Rather than arguing over the amount as I was on my lunch break, I paid the bill and left.  Once I arrived back at the office and opened the bag, everything had spilled all over the inside of the bag.  What I could salvage was flavorless and greasy.  I threw it out and had wished I had never given this shit hole place a chance.  I would never return again.  The only fusion they offer is the fusion of shitty service and even shittier food.

1YQota2juHPR-5HXXbOKIA.text: I ordered takeout with my family and our experience with Tottie's Asian Fusion was mediocre at best.  With the name Tottie's Asian "FUSION" you usually expect a new, and exciting take of two cuisines blended together.  However when you look at the menu, it is clear that it is just a standard asian restaurant menu.  We started our meal with the Wonton Soup which we all admitted was not bad.  Had plenty of meat and nice wontons.  We also ordered Shrimp Tempura Spring Rolls which might as well have been just lettuce wrapped up in rice paper.  The ratio of veggies/cabbage to shrimp was absurd, and if you told me shrimp was in there I would told you to "GET OUTTA HEEEERREEE!"  For the entree, I had the Shrimp in Lobster Sauce.  It was ok but lacked any seasoning or flavor; a theme that frequently reared it's head throughout the meal.  My mom's House Chow Fun was similar:  OK, but not anything that would wow you for the price.  Finally my dad had the Beef Chop Suey which was bland, and had no sauce what so ever.  It may however  had sauce when boxed up, but I am not sure as the boxes the entrees where packed in were flimsy styrofoam containers that leaked and kept our food nice and...."warm".  We did order a Tottie's Fried Rice, however they forgot to include it in the bag.  My mom did call in and they were very quick to apologize and credit our account which I appreciate.  Overall, we found the food to not be worth the price charged.  Mediocre asian food, however if you are the only show in town (aside from P.F. Chang and Pei Wei), you can often get away with that.  Maybe the food is better in the restaurant, however I doubt my family will be back to try and find out.

IKB84Pgx8E7QDj-zBKzhHA.text: Okay, I could probably live without Asian food.  I like Chinese and Thai on occasion, especially if it's cold out.  The rest of it I wouldn't miss.  Sorry, Mexico is my True love.  But I have to say, I love Tottie's, if for no other reason than the Green Curry.  It is easily one of my favorite dishes right now.  I've tried both the lemon and tangerine chicken (apparently I could not live without citrus), and while good, they cannot compete with the green curry.  Generally I would prefer Chinese to Thai, or so I thought.  I know, it's like comparing apples to oranges.  I also really like the Tottie rolls.  The spring rolls taught me I'm not a fan of rice paper, but I loved the peanut sauce.  Anything dipped in that peanut sauce would be good!  Given its location,  I was pleasantly surprised that Tottie's is actually quite nice inside, although we usually get take-out.  In fact, today is quite chilly.  I think that curry is calling me.

gE_Mqry9-S-Vb--OPMNXCg.text: After visiting Tottie's a few more times recently it seems at the owners/management is failing at quality control. Less attention is paid to detail and the taste is losing its pizzazz. I really hope they reflect on internal quality so the restaurant doesn't continue its downward trend.

YFL8MmPYAgyIVBad9geyRw.text: My fiance and I love this place. It is a hidden gem and our go-to sushi spot. We always have a great experience but our dinner last night was even more outstanding thanks to the great service from our waiter Doug. He was so professional and pleasant. Despite the fact that he was extremely busy he took quality time at each table and kept a smile on his face the whole night. He was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. That is the definition of excellent customer service. I would recommend this place to anyone!

4fIDkVpzxlM3JHG_CA9IRg.text: Located in the back corner of the mall.  Quick takeout. Interior seating is nice with a L bar for sushi and plenty of booths for groups.  The fried egg roll appetizer was very good with plenty of pork filling. The pad see ew was over spiced with what I believe is basil, but a very large portion.  They give plenty of beef and broccoli in the pad see ew, but not enough noodles, I would have preferred a little more.  I also like how they ask what level of spice you'd like, 0 - 10; after ordering a level 2, there was barely any spice to it, I can't imagine what a 0 would be, nor could I imagine the level of spice in a 10.

Q_VKQ6K_uD1rxhPH_GZrpQ.text: Excellent food! I love love love it! Beautiful ambiance- tall bamboos, colorful walls - it is such a  positive place that just dining there refreshes my mind. Now for the food, great selection of drinks, very nice lend of both chinese and thai menu, Love the taste of their crispy fried rice soup-sizzling sound too :). My favs are a lot of their spicy sauces and curries. Must try if you like asian food!  If they are too busy, service gets slow given that there ain't too many servers, but I go there to sit and dine at ease so no complaints. They have a small patio seating available as well and live music sometimes over the weekend.

Jei5vCpesvaB3a1UPsTu7g.text: Great food and atmosphere.  Had the beef pho and green curry. I would recommend both of them!

Q_JebMYxr3Cy-rneYfMOIg.text: Gotta throw Tottie's into the rotation. Several options from sushi to Chinese to Thai. Pad Thai here is phenomenal. Be careful on the heat level. I normally go with a 2, but I am kind of a wuss when it comes to spicy  food .   Anybody ever get a level six spicy?  Also I've noticed that the often have soccer on TV.. love this.

N2xK4T8r9IXTYwzeVlra-w.text: Staff was great and helpful. Kept refilling my drink as needed. Definitely a go-to spot for the area

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crispy beef with Thai basil yuuuummm
Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dragonfly  so good

McgqMBoRmPNOphUcApVwtw.text: Best place!!!! Been coming here for quite a long time and it is my go-to for Hot and Sour soup. Try the Tottie Rolls, YUM!!!!

MIu9o6S6hyBEfHH-IZbZYg.text: My family and I went to Totties for a celebration dinner.  We all ordered different things to try. We were all pleasantly surprised. The panang and lemongrass stir fry were among the best Asian dishes we've ever eaten.   Service was fast, prices are very reasonable and serving amounts are more than enough.   We can't wait to go back!

fuUVlOW9ItFYcQezgFizMQ.text: I've lived near this restaurant for years and never tried it before. Sorry I wasted so much time! It's so good! The food is high quality prepared amazingly well the portions are really big and the people are very nice! Happy to have found a place so close with such good food! Can't wait to go back and try more dishes. We had sesame chicken, General Tso's chicken, cashew chicken, pad se ew, potstickers, and fried rice and loved it all!

erxEcEL9pVKu9e1IYSjbhQ.text: This place is off the charts.  I've been coming here for years, and I've never had a dish I didn't like.  The soups are phenomenal, as are most of the appetizers, especially the Tottie Rolls.  I had Chicken Chop Suey and it's by far the best I've ever had.  Perfect flavors, extremely fresh veggies!  I can't say enough great things about this place.  10 stars...

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome Chicken Chop Suey

T_6ZTrWXbxoEQwGE0E4Q0g.text: I didn't have high expectations for the place after one of my friends said he had a poor experience with their lunch menu. I asked a question about the Chang Mai Noodles (more like noodles in curry) and the server told me that was her favorite dish. I am a fan of medium-hot spicy, so I asked for a Level 4 spicy with chicken.   It was incredible. I'm not much of a Yelp reviewer but this is one of my favorite Thai dishes of all time. I'm a big fan of curry in general and the coconut milk based spicy curry with chicken was perfect with a blend of squash, carrot strips, cabbage strips and bamboo shoots with the rice noodles. I had to share this with the world!  Oh and it was good as leftovers too!

4jY1a-XEs90NQa8XVLFffQ.text: I love this place!!! I always get the red Chicken Panang level 4 because sometimes it's super spicy depending on the chef and the Tottie Rolls are unbelievable! Those are my favorites but they have a big menu and everything is good. They also have Pho . I don't know if they have a full bar but they do serve wine and have a Happy Hour. The restaurant looks like a hole in the wall in a little shopping plaza but the food is incredibly delicious and the service is great. You will not be disappointed!!!!

KRGIzYvokA-lJY_oI6WzqA.text: I've frequented Tottie's likely a dozen times now. It's generally my go-to neighborhood restaurant when looking for Asian flavors (other than Vietnamese). They're selection is wide as it is a 'fusion' establishment. Their Chicken Pad Thai is the best I've found in Arizona. Honestly, It's really delicious. I now get it every single time. Their totties house fried rice is really quite good but not phenomenal. I still order it frequently tho. I've had little of their sushi rolls but was definitely pleased from what I remember.  I'll certainly continue dining and ordering from Totties!

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My favorite Pad Thai (in AZ). Very, very good

TSdVT23rhfXnr4KaBLtDNQ.text: PROPA Penang curry dish. Wow wow wow. Very good stuff. The edamame was ok. But the Penang was amazing

sgDOoKSEZpLaA9070YV6zQ.text: I used to really enjoy the food from Totties as many local residents do but I'm not sure what happened on Sunday night but our take-out was somewhat disappointing. As usual I ordered the sizzling rice soup and as always it was very good, thus the 2 stars but it went downhill from there. The egg rolls were basically 4 empty crispy shells and the Mongolian beef was spicier than I expected especially having ordered it before but the worst part was that the  beef was tough and chewy where it usually is so tender. Definitely not worth the price we paid.

cIxndGTKVg216sLhLSlb6Q.text: Great appetizers great food super friendly staff for our first time here was amazing def recommend it

o0cdLCue8E4j8Liz7tt0AA.text: I loved it. I ordered the garlic chicken spiced  at a 6 and shrimp fried rice all to go. The staff was awesome and helpful. Even the patrons were super friendly when they heard me say I didn't know what to order but I love spicy food. I'll be back for sure.

8Re_3STgroQ-xiBm9Y-ePw.text: I literally live down the street and haven't had the chance to try this place out and I am upset that I haven't until now! This place is a hidden gem and has the best fusion and selection of the best Asian dishes! We went on Xmas eve and the service was awesome the whole restaurant was way larger than it seemed from looking at its outside exterior. Full bar and several tables to make it intimate. Staff was super friendly. I recommend the chow fun with shrimp and firecracker chicken. Everything is so good on the menu. Must go if you love Asian food from Vietnamese to Chinese to a little Korean flare.

ltx2oeJ7h047qdz9-1oGog.text: Spring rolls and Pho or Pad Thai. Every. Single. Time. Without fail. I always go in thinking "oh maybe I'll try something new and different this time" but the moment I sit down...nope, spring rolls and either Pho or Pad Thai. Their food isn't the absolute best I've ever had....but somehow, Tottie's is my favorite. Don't know how that works. My best friend always gets the Tottie rolls, which are also really good too. I'd say this location is better than the Scottsdale Rd. location, due to better service and a more laid back atmosphere.

67naa-N3k3CvRnewPy011g.text: First time at this restaurant and the service was amazing. Food was really really good but my husband didn't like his dish as much as some other places. We ordered the tempura spring roll which was excellent and we both really enjoyed.  My dish was the coconut curry panang with shrimp. Really good dish and I have plenty of left overs as the portion sizes are large. My husband had the pad ka pau and it was good but he likes another places better. Overall great experience and the server was always on top of everything and ready to get anything we needed. Will come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Panang with shrimp
Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pad ga pra

efUukbQozTcTorlAgHVYhA.text: We got the house fried rice and the chicken chow fun and both were just ok. We were hoping for a bit more flavor and neither had much and the shrimp puffs were overcooked. The place inside was really cute inside and pretty busy but the food just didnt do it for us.

k8OY8Kz8pY7TLoiiqIjlpQ.text: Just heading out for some Chinese Food and decided to try something new for us. How have we missed this place before. Everything exceeded our expectations from service, kind and attentive, atmosphere pleasant and comfortable, of course and the food. Great variety of Sushi , Thai , and normal Chinese Food . What a great surprise the Thai Fried Rice  was . Enjoy

YlMb1qa_igCEiXoAosafrA.text: I use to eat here every couple weeks but the food is not as good as it use to be. The tottie rolls were amazing. Last time they were greasy and had holes in the wrapper so the grease got inside too!  Not tastey.

XCmi3tohizH10DstyWU76w.text: I went here once a few years ago, loved it and then filed it away in my brain since it was far away.  Now that I live closer, I decided to return.  It was just as good as I remembered, maybe better.  I loved the Panang Curry, and tried my friend's General Tso Chicken.  That was delicious, next time I'll need to try something else on the Chinese part of the menu.  The server was friendly and enthusiastic about the menu, making sure to tell us about the ice cream made with coconut milk.  It sounds interesting and I'll try to save room for it next time.  It's nice to have a place I like that has Chinese, Thai, and Vietnamese all in one menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pad Thai with Chicken, I chose a 3 out of 7 on the spice level and it was fantastic!
Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tom Kha, a delicious Thai soup with coconut milk.  Medium spicy with chicken was perfect!

-pn0Cu1ugw7iZbzq7my08w.text: Updated: Well, I've been back to Tottie's since I first posted this review.  A few friends who like it made me go.  Much to my surprise, I enjoyed it.  It's no Malee's for Thai, for example, but it's decent.  If you frequent the area for lunch, definitely check it out.  Who knows, you may like it more than me.  Original Review: While the food wasn't terrible, I found the sesame chicken and cashew chicken to be bland.  And, the chicken itself was too chewy.  I've had worse, but not by much.

i4CKYSBfcfDHnD0Ww2deNA.text: Enjoyed dinner at Tottie's last week, same great taste but the service was even better --didn't think that was possible.    one issue, i LOVE spicy--we got our pad thai at "8" and it was way too hot to eat--it was still good and we picked at it but i just think that there was some mistake.  *and* i didn't say anything because we were already getting full--i took it home and the next day added it to a ton of rice noodles and it was even better.    also, you MUST try the desserts--homemade coconut ice cream and these fried bananas.  really, to die for.

Dayhsv8ehyPt__C5Ja1Tvw.text: Don't let the name fool you!!!!  There is NOTHING FUSION about this place... Ok, that food was decent but I came expecting "Asian Fusion" and therefore was disappointed.  Fusion means the combination of two or more cuisines in ONE DISH.  This place simply offers Thai, Sushi, Chinese and Vietname all SEPARATELY.  It is more like food court or buffet in that it offers many different options.  I ordered my default dish when I am not that hungry.  The sweat and sour chicken was mediocre.  If that was the only food item I tried I would not come back.  Fortunately I was with a group and got to try the green curry and lemon grass chicken which was pretty tasty.  What enjoyed most was they way they spiced it up.  You can choose how spicey you want your dish (between 1-10) and whatever they use adds a lot of taste and the approprirate balance of heat.

MQkPQkucYBkABiYaA8vbJQ.text: We absolutely love the sizzling rice soup, and have had it multiple times since we first found Tottie's about a month ago.  We typically get it to go, but also had a good sit down experience last week. The restaurant is beautiful and our waitress was very friendly.  Our soup was superb as usual, though we weren't overly impressed with our sushi choices.  Either way, we'll definitely go back!

I4_rm2ngp4PZwv1G21D0VQ.text: I don't understand all of the great reviews of this place. The food here is pretty blah. I feel like they use the same 3 ingredients in every dish, as if they don't want to actually supply the ingredients that the dishes need. Everything tastes ok, but just really off. Maybe that it was they mean by 'fusion'? Fusing Asian food with random meh flavor?  The staff here is pretty disappointing, also, which is the main reason why I don't return. I have tried eating here probably 5 or 6 times between dining in and taking out. The last time was so disappointing. I was second hand embarrassed for this restaurant. Their staff that night, of 4 or 5 twenty-somethings, all stood at the front of the restaurant talking loudly about idiotic things they had done over the weekend. My boyfriend and i couldnt even have a conversation because we could hear ever single word they were saying. So rude. And annoying. Honestly, they spent a good 35 minutes doing this(the entire time we were there, I'm sure they kept going even after we left). It was sad really, that a business would tolerate this kind of behavior from their employees. My first job at Pizza Hut when I was 16 wouldn't even allow that kind of BS.  So, basically, their meh food doesn't make up for their UGH service, therefore making take out not worth it, and dining in miserable. Sorry Totti :(

QCa0yAF8W1QB6yM_lJCJDQ.text: In keeping with my brevity, great food, service a little slow at times. Mango sticky rice a must.

C5_7avE7pZYopJ3rss39yA.text: I would have given it more stars if either service or food was good.  But both were mediocre.  The only thing that was good was the Jasmine tea.  We went there for lunch and most waiters were very young and untrained.   Nothing against being young, but they didn't know how to be a good waiter.  First they forgot about our table and didn't come to get our order for 15 min.  After they brought our food, they never came to check if we had enough water to re-fill it. We made small modification to one of the dishes and they put the extra veggies in the wrong dish.  Waiters were courteous, but green.  They just need to be trained better.  Food was subpar.  We are from Seattle area, so we are accustomed to higher quality Asian dishes. Maybe the folks who gave this place higher star haven't had really good Asian food to compare against.

qKaHq3Nw4Lhw9eEMO6X-Cw.text: **4.5 stars**  My first experience with Totties was when it was just Shanghai Palace, and although the food was solid (filling and delicious) each time, the atmosphere was that of any other mom and pop Asian restaurant.  Every few months I would remember that this place, which is basically next door to me, existed.    Since the major decoration about a year ago, I average eating here at least once every other week, even when I worked here.  Tottie has managed to create a place that is simply her--fabulous.  The food has lost none of its spice (Thai spicy still makes my stomache burn delightfully), but now married with it is an atmosphere that's vibrant, alive, and slightly whimsical.

UglkP_DcRqWoeSVGw7dz3Q.text: Really good food!  One day I was out front of Fresh-n-Easy and I smelled some really good smells!  I looked around and saw Tottie's.  Two days later I still could not get it out of my head so I invited my mom for lunch.  We shared Pad Thai and Panang Chicken.  I like food really hot so we got medium for my mom.  Even medium was a bit mild, but it was really good food.  The lunch special came with hot and sour soup and rice.  The hot and sour soup was different that what I was used to, but it was sooooo good I went back the next day for a large take out.  it was even more amazing the second time!!!

VTUCPOSGqnITdI8D9Aisag.text: So happy I finally came!! This time, as I will b back, I had a Thai tea which was delicious with sweet and sour chicken that was better than most in the valley, loaded with veggies but a good sauce. There is so much that this place has to offer so I will def b back soon with new updates on the thai, sushi and vietnamese that this restaurant offers.

Qj52adbXPVn1rNd7cdXkYw.text: Glad to have this restaurant in my neighborhood, the only thing that would make it better for me would be a patio, you know for the dog to come with. Reasonable price, had a great red curry!

kpfU11eC1NpQxm8mEK64Aw.text: This place used to be really good under it's old name. I don't know what it is with the new owners, but things here are slowly changing. My boyfriend and I used to go down and get a lot of noodle dishes. The noodles were delicious! But now they have even switched the kind of noodles they use in their plates.   Last time we went my boyfriend ordered some sushi, we got dumplings, and just hung out. My boyfriend said the sushi is "alright" but way over priced. Nothing compared to other sushi we have had in the valley (can I mention Celcius next to dessert ridge here? Delicious). The dumplings were a big disappointment. Not only did we have to wait 15 minutes because they were steamed. Way tasteless little things. The wrapper was all chewy. I'll never order it again. We also ordered egg rolls, and I think that was the best part of the entire night.  Meh. I probably won't be back. Even though it's walking distance from my apartment.  On a good note: They were open on new years eve, and it wasn't packed at all :) Waiters are always nice here. Just the food saddens me.

utbfE6QL7USMnLa6DW0Nmg.text: 1. Front Door Wait for table, hostess was busy and had 3 takeout orders + 3 couples at one time plus answering phone. took us 10 minutes just to get seated in a place that had only 12 seated customers n 20+ tables open.  2. Once seated, the staff, busser, waitress, AWESOME.. they knew the regular peoples names, and weren't over powering asking if everything is ok, just right.   3. Appetizer. Broadway Rolls..  Tasted Fresh shrimp, n crab, but crab was minced, but tasted awesome.. very pleased,  4. PhoTai and Shanghai Rice, Both great.. for Vietnamese Pho, i would rate this 3rd on my list of places to order Pho. Rice, it ranks 2nd.. fresh shrimp, and chicken was cooked, but not overdone and dry,, excellent..   Final say. I will be back. This may be monthly, due to travel distance Chandler to Scottsdale.. If i want Vietnamese, without the extra variety, Da Vang, or Phu thanh. But if i bring some friends, this would be the best place, because of the variety of the cuisine.

4LdhUdap0jEiA_kWmDAp9Q.text: I got the stir fry vegetables with brown sauce, brown rice and avocado ice cream.  The veg and rice were great with the brown sauce, the avocado ice cream is an acquired taste.  Scenery was nice and the staff was friendly.  I like the fact that you can get Chinese, Vietnamese, Tia and Japanese food. Would go there again!

4f7eZ2qBk_62a9bKjwcnJQ.text: Very friendly, quick service, and great food.  Hands down one of my favorite places to go eat!

EMv9AfbWY31zXWq0pVlsNg.text: Oh Totties, I love you. I have been there 3 times in the past 3 weeks and have gotten something different each time and enjoyed it each time. Sushi-amazing, Chinese-pretty good!, Tottie Rolls=orgasm inside your mouth, Thai=no comment, I've never had Thai before haha so I had no idea what to expect/look for for good Thai. Everything I've had here tasted so good. I love the decor and feel inside, you never would of expect this restaurant to look that nice from the outside. We've had 3 different servers each time, the first 2 times the servers were awesome and the 3rd server was just okay (she forgot a couple things here & there). For starters I recommend the Egg Drop Soup, Wonton Soup, and Hot & Sour Soup.The coconut ice cream with fried bananas is an amazing end to your meal. I would highly recommend this place to everyone I know.

iqnLBCt6E1hC9nm4Qb07xA.text: Had to try this fusion as I have been looking for some good soup, and I was really surprised! The Pho was tasty, just had to add my Siracha. The Padang chicken was the really good part! I got a 5 on a 1-10 scale. Wasn't spicy enough, so I will go up next time. Glad I stopped to check it out.

GPofw2RsYaxE8LEu-yWtfA.text: I kept hearing about this place when I moved onto Thomas and Hayden and it did not disappoint. Everything was delicious. The waitress was quite the sales woman but she was right about everything so it was a good thing we trusted her suggestions. I will definitely hit this place up whenever I am craving some asian food!

Uo_zFPF08FO8BSDOOsZCwA.text: One of my favorites! Panang! The spicy coconut curry males my mouth water and feeds my craving! Don't let the strip mall location deceive you, it's not typical, food is awesome, and the entire feel is cool Asian fusion. Love it---panang here I come!

mEltUU25Wi4AAIbABP_7Yw.text: So I went across this place on yelp. With all the good reviews me and my bf decide to try it out. When we got there we had to wait 15 min for anyone to come to greet us and once we been seated we had waited another 15 min for a waitress to take our order. The hot tea was like plain hot water. We order two appetizer and two entrees the what so call best egg roll you've ever tasted was like the worst egg roll I've ever tasted in my life it was so soggy inside! The scewred beef was tasteless.  The house special chowmein was anything but special.  And the shrimp green bean and black bean sauce was terrible the shrimp tasted like dirt and green beans was from a frozen pre cooked bag. So so disappointed . How does this place get such good reviews I don't get it??!

oGSU-i3x1ymbc8ivIcfwQQ.text: Great lunch spot! Good specials and great menu variety. Quick service makes it easy to get in and out for lunch. Recommend the Bun Tom!

fqhdnhqgfsC_RUpOvEc5qg.text: Atmosphere is superb, casual but authentic and intimate. Doug is one of the most excellent servers ever and wish we could bottle up his enthusiasm!   We ordered tom kha gai and pahnang curry. it was excellent!! Every dish is made to order so all can be happy!!! highly recommend this place.

4PHkGfO9_Nbbg4-eceNaYw.text: Pho spots in Old Town are as rare as beauty and brains. Service is good and may be the reason I come back; that and my go-to spot was closed. Take out is quick. Tottie egg rolls are decent. Dipping sauce is purely fish sauce so if you're not Asian, ask for sweet and sour sauce. Pho broth is ok but you can mask bland with sriracha. Side note, boiling oxtail shouldn't be rocket science. For the price, I have had better especially when there was a rumble in my tummy. If it wasn't the rent for space, I think Scottsdale would be flooded with noodle houses. East Valley definitely has got this down.

Tu0uvrso25lAqgzMf1yfLQ.text: Subpar food, horrible service. After ordering 5 chicken dishes for takeout, all five of us quickly came to the conclusion that there was almost zero chicken in any of our meals (2-4 pieces tiny per dish). We called to let them know when we were met with rude skepticism of our claims. They asked if it was just one dish, to which I told them it was all 5 of them. They offered to comp 1 dish and I replied that if they comped 2 that would be fine. They then replied that they would only comp 1...I said thank you and hung up. I usually would be very forgiving for the problems with the food, but the complete lack of decent service prompted me to make this review to warn others.

Svym3O5hdYu1ykgSQ04NTw.text: This place was great. We came here on Christmas night, and both the food and the service were exemplary. I had the Singapore noodles, with a soft she'll crab appetizer. The flavors were delicate but well balanced, and the food came out quickly.

cf1pWQv2ks6z4CuUJ0-byg.text: This review PAINS me to write...because I used to be obsessed with Tottie's. I wonder if they changed cooks?  Anyway - The sushi is still fantastic, the menu drink options are well chosen, and I LOVE the restaurant decor/aesthetics. Now onto the the sadness...  The food is lacking flavor now. Everything is just...blah. Again, this pains me because I really used to like this place. I suppose, since I have gone all over the Valley in search of the perfect Thai Curries (I swear, I have found them) this place no longer holds up.  Still, I'll be back for the sushi and house wines served up by kind people in a great looking place.  1 star for each of its merits.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mackerel Nigiri (forefront) Toostie Roll (background).
Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon Sashimi

feyT294jFbzJDU9Yc3B0IA.text: I love love love everything I've ever had at this place. The Thai food is to die for especially! And the service is always great, friendly and accommodating!

hV0FyyPoYucItmUHhYhQCA.text: LOVE Tottie's! Who knew such a swanky, wallet friendly place could be in a location like this?   When we walked in, I was overtaken with the decor. But then we sat down and I was overtaken with it's extensive menu--they not only have sushi but Japanese, Thai and Vietnamese. They have a lot of different sushi rolls and also gives you a description of each one (One of them things most sushi places do which drives me batty!) Service was on point and quick to take our order and get anything we needed. I got the Flaming Tuna Roll and Broadway Roll and both were fresh and full of flavor. I love spicy stuff and the Broadway is not for the faint of heart--be sure to have some water nearby if you're going to try this one.  The only thing I disliked about Tottie's is that I live on the other side of the country and can't go back there any time I want, sadface.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

e7EMSgYOitrJPnumRoA-Tw.text: I've been coming to this place since it used to have a different name more than 10 years ago. Their food is amazing.  Sometimes we come in just for soup, I get Pho, my daughter gets sizzling rice, my husband Pho as well.  I love the Thai dishes, I'm a panang fanatic!  My husband usually get's something with fish.  We have brought at least 15 of our best friends and family and they love it too.  They have chinese selections, and have different chefs tending to different regions.  They Sushi guy rocks it too. Dessert calls for mango sticky rice or one of their sumptuous home made ice creams. This is a family owned place, and they have opened another one a it further north on Scottsdale Rd.  Both restaurants are stunningly decorated and clean as you can find.  Don't miss this place.

fBkQ84tiJjUyiK4NQiCe4Q.text: I really wanted to like this place... But the flavors where just off from what I usually like. I'm sure it probably tastes really good for ppl who like it, but it's like comparing little Caesars to hungry howies. Yeah, they're both pizza, but they taste fundamentally different. The serving sizes were bountiful, it was all hot and looked good. But when you have a specific flavor in mind and what you're eating just doesn't match up its hard to enjoy. This is more about me than anything. But I think people who are looking for flavors that line up with Thai Rama or Thai Basil, you're not going to get that here. I would be interested in trying some of their other again dishes, just not their thai selection.

afN1RAlqVu4VA86t5Dp3gQ.text: Try the Larb, it is on happy hour and it even comes in tofu as a veggie option. This one dish alone ($5) at happy hour would make me love this place but there were many more delights that made my visit so great.  I don't drink with dinner but here it was happy hour all day sat, and they had a unique drink the Curry Gimlet, IT comes in a martini glass has a orange hue, it is fruity but has a curry finish from cardamom I assume, truly unique.  Our dishes of Pad See ewe and Dragon noodles were great, and huge portions.   Rich flavors, well textured tofu and crisp veggies.   When I made my reservation I let them know about the birthday of the person I was with. We were surprised with fried banana and ice cream along with a candle and signing it was great!

ATAJqFJmTv9Sn2VuYnFBvA.text: Second time here, the first time the Tom Yum soup was pretty good, this time we ordered two pots, and it was far too salty and far too acidic. Spice level is fine at medium, but none of the four of us finished a bowl. They did take one of the pots of soup off the bill, but they weren't terribly busy and service was not Swift to say the least. Two of the other entrees were pretty good, so there's that. If they wanted me to come back and try them for a third time, they really should've taken both soups off the bill, as they could see from the contents of both parts that they had barely been touched as it. As it is, I'm not going back. Far too many other places that have a better soup then even the first time we were there to consider it. How they're on Phoenix top 100 list? Well they have nice ambience.

_lAH-1GOsN6_d_Uz4Jccgw.text: Tried Vegetable Pho, Vegetarian vermicelli fried noodles and Veggie Sushi. All of the dishes were really tasty.

j89yyGnOkICeQ4GGKJz4Ew.text: Delicious food.  This place is one of the hidden gems in South Scottsdale.  I used to eat here every day for lunch until my weight line started to protest.  It's been a while since I've been here, but they used to have really good lunch specials.  For only $7 or $8 you would get the main course, plus an eggroll, rice, and soup.  Really good deal, especially considering how tasty everything is.  All the servers are extremely friendly too.    Eat here!  You're missing out if you don't try it at least once.

4jrjWWoehONzqE2gTTNiXg.text: Bonus! Happy hour until 7:00pm  Ordered: Tom kha gai, pad kra pao at level 3 spice, mango sticky rice.   The tom kha gai was delightful, wish I just had that for an entree! The pad kra pao had zero flavor, so I ended up eating my friend's pad thai at 0 spice just so I didn't leave hungry. That was pretty decent. I have never had mango sticky rice in order to say how it compares for a rating, but it wasn't as mind blowing as I expected it to be... kind of made me think of Cream of Wheat.

xp4xYIfr9g6haQ2IBBYRJQ.text: The food and service was fantastic the first time we went.  I went in last night and while waiting in line, I decided to go to the bathroom.  It was beyond atrocious.  You can't tell me that some employee there hadn't seen it like this.  I turned around and left.  I will never, ever eat there again nor will I ever recommend it again.  Extremely unacceptable.

kMikhvhaqA4nKwKiFuTfCQ.text: The waitress I had at lunch time today was very customer service oriented. She knew the menu and was refilling drinks fast. The food came out fresh, hot, and tasted amazing. I would recommend this place to anyone and will bring my friends. Thank you for a great experience.

KuyveRCKLOBxbjL5UiJZuQ.text: I saw the Check Please, Arizona that featured Tottie's and arrived with high expectations. We were seated promptly and water war provided as well. Our waitress was very busy and doing a heroic job, however service was spotty as a result. It's the food that was the major disappointment. The first couple of things we wanted from the printed menu had been discontinued, bummer but we adapted. We ordered the traditional spring rolls with shrimp and pork. I found the pork but couldn't find the shrimp. In every other shrimp spring roll I have ordered the shrimp was plainly visible, even highlighted. Just fair.  The next was the Tom Kha Gai soup. ordered it 5 of 7 on a spicy scale and it wasn't spicy at all and barely warmed. It is obvious that they pre-make this soup and just reheat it to order and not completely in our case. It was served in one of those sterno powered hot pot warmers. The soup was better after it warmed a while although the ladle given was too wide to actually fit in the soup trough, made seconds problematic. Just fair,  Spicy Thai Seafood had all the ingredients but was ordered a 5 and it came out a 1 on a spicy scale. Not very attractive was garnished with a few carrot slices sort of feathered on one side. Knife work poor overall. Disappointing.  Lemon grass stir-fry was the same disappointing plate hard to distinguish from my Spicy Thai Seafood in looks. Ordered a 5 and came out barely a one, again on the Spice scale Disappointing.  It's a disservice if the photography of a TV Show has vivid and beautiful colors with artistic knife work and the real version isn't even up to Pandas Express standards.  Not terrible but disappointing. No owner or manager were seen, the place was just running by itself and not too well at that.

hRvKWTQ-sHhop4B9CVx7FQ.text: Just went in for a quick bite and Brittany was my server. She was delightful and very personal, there was another server there named Alex and they were a great team. Will definitely keep going back. Thanks!

UejVSjwSFfEdww_N9pAHlQ.text: Sooo delicious! Definitely a place for a great lunch  - soup and an egg roll is included which is a PLUS! Their fried tofu is to die for, I just wish they would add more to the dishes. However, definitely worth to stop in!

WkkH6VsvzPzD3-ZhzlUw7Q.text: 6/15/16 Mom and I haven't been to this location in a long time, as we go to one on Scottsdale Rd. (between McDonald and Lincoln, and listed in Paradise Valley) since it is closer to where we live. We noticed that this location is less-busy than the other, which isn't telling much, as the other location doesn't get very busy either, at least not at the times when we go, which usually is around happy hour/before 6 pm. At the time of our arrival, around 5 pm, there was only one Caucasian woman seating and serving the entire restaurant-- about six different parties, two of which arrived before ours. She seemed very busy, taking large strides, almost-sprinting, and trying to get water glasses to the tables and answering questions. By the time we'd placed our orders it was around 5:20 pm. At 5:25 pm, a second employee, a young Asian man, walked in. Ah, more needed help has arrived. Thai iced tea: Good, but very sweet. Make sure to order an extra glass of ice to pour into to help lessen the sweetness level! yelp.com/user_local_phot... Guava mimosa: Listed on the happy hour menu, under Tropical Mimosas, for $5. Other options include mango, lychee, and pineapple! Very happy to see this offering, as I am allergic to oranges, so I normally avoid mimosas. I've only seen grapefruit** mimosas offered elsewhere, so to see guava and lychee as additional choices impresses me! I'll be back just to try the other choices. Btw, the guava was good, but it could've used a little more sweetness. I sipped this one first, before trying the Thai iced tea, just to check its sweetness level. I suggest adding sugar to taste, or perhaps Tottie's could offer a moscato d'asti as a sweeter alternative to the sparkling wine that is used. Green curry with beef: Delicious, with good-quality beef (tender, and not sinewy), but the curry was too watery. yelp.com/user_local_phot... Love that the veggies included can be omitted and substituted according to food issues/allergies. Also love that Tottie's offers steamed egg noodles as an additional side for someone like me who is allergic to rice. Price for side noodles has increased to $3.50 a bowl, when it was only $2 a year, or two ago. Almost double the original price, but still somewhat reasonable. If the cost of the noodles were to increase even more AND the curry remains watery (as opposed to silky), I may have to look elsewhere for my green curry and egg noodle fix. Soft-shelled crab curry! yelp.com/user_local_phot... This was the dish that brought Mom and me back again and again. I've decided to stay away from crab this year, as the last time I had it, my allergy symptoms were worse. Simply not worth the pain and suffering. Mom enjoyed this dish, and it looked beautiful. We did notice that it came with less crab pieces (four halves, instead of the previous six-- check out my older photos). It's been awhile since we last visited, so it would be nice if the menu listed the number of pieces, as well as the cost of additional crab ($3 each, and sliced into halves). Note that you may want to ask for a few pieces placed on the side, if you intend to take leftovers home-- that way, you may revive them in the (toaster) oven and will not soggy upon re-heat! Will probably just go to the one on Scottsdale Rd. from now on, since we like the Filipina server there. We also usually see Tottie herself roaming around, and she usually comes and greets us, which is always a nice touch.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Thai iced tea and Guava mimosa!

CyUo-9Ehktd6kRA2rrpBXg.text: This was my first time here and my last! Their was no communication between the host, wait staff and manger.  We waited 45min for PHO. We asked once why it was taking so long and was told they have a lot of take out orders to fill?? I'm sorry but your sit down restaurant patrons wait due to orders for take out?? That's Not Right and 45mins?? As we we're getting up to leave here came the PHO.  I said a 45 min wait for soup  is unacceptable! They dropped a take out order on the floor and pretty sure it was just thrown in another paper bag and sent out.  If you want good service don't bother with this place. The manger didn't even bother to make apologies just kept saying we have take out orders ahead of restaurant orders.  Omgosh

bp99T9Oo6PrEuUN9T_1K8g.text: Wow , after dining here about 20 times since we moved here about two years ago I never thought I would be posting a poor review here . We can in three of us , it was quite busy at the time . Waited in line about 10 minutes , while a disgruntled to go order recipient tried to get it fixed . I guess the owner swung by and said 5 minutes , ok , I'm in the business I know it's looking like they weren't ready for this amount of business , it happens , I more than understand . The young host finally took us back to a booth , but when we arrived it was not finished being cleaned etc... no big deal , I start to kind of wipe down surface , when the man whom I assume is the owner came over extremely rude and told my wife , you three over there , just go over there as he glared at the host who sat us . We went and stood by the bar and watched him walk past us about 15 more times , as we could see the table had been finished for us , but he or anyone said nothing , so my wife had enough , she loves Totties , but being treated like that is unacceptable at any business . We left , I am and have been in the hospitality business 35 years in every aspect , I've seen plenty , this was one of our favorites and living about 100 yards away made it even better . Treating customers like that will always start the downfall of a place even with the wonderful food served by Totties , we will surely miss that spot

KkOuFcWotVI7Hi1GZv-42w.text: Yummy!  This place has amazing food and a great atmosphere.  They can convert almost every entree to a vegan version and can even make vegan thai iced tea!!  Yessss!!!  The staff was very helpful and I will be coming back.  I highly recommend checking it out!

a3EUF-DCzOy_9dAK3DfU0A.text: Fabulous food served with kindness and attention. What a great moment!! We simply love it.

KRsXwuMRZz5XS4FfggxG5w.text: Had dinner with family there recently.  I'm a vegetarian. My food had pieces of chicken dropped in by mistake.  I brought it my server's attention and she said it would take too long to replace the meal and insinuated I just had to deal with it!  I was shocked.  It was quite busy but to make no attempt to remedy the situation shocked me.  I should have been the one to make the call to wait or not.  Plus she really should have asked the kitchen to rush my reorder. The other 3 people I was with ate their meal and we left.  They were quite uncomfortable with the situation as well. I really would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.  .

UGBoKkCWo-bwKUN2xuKLng.text: Had a very bad experience here. Still waiting to hear from owner and it's been days. Had a party of 12 at the restaurant and was given a gift worth about $200 we were the last ones in there and I left the gift right on top of the table. I called the restaurant  After we left and left a message on tree voicemail. I called the next morning before lunch and was told they were getting ready for lunch and would call me back but the person who answered was sure that it was there  and would get back to me shortly. I never got a call back. I called at night and was told sorry there's nothing they could do they could not find it. If it was morning I could have gone in and searched but I was put off. No one has called to apologize or discuss any remedy for the situation. I have not heard from the wait staff nor the owner. In my opinion this is terrible behavior. The item was on the smaller side but certainly was large enough that it  could not be overlooked.   It was right on top of the table. If someone threw it out by accident I could have tried to fish it out of the garbage in the morning had they been responsive. I do not know if this was the case but no one has even said that they threw it out. They would know if they did.  The only reason this has one star is because you have to put 1 in in order to get on Yelp.

BrkhaajA9P0cuKevGrWJng.text: This place was a DELIGHT!  The food was great, the service was great, and I love the choices. We are vegan and they had many options for us as well. They were very sensitive to our food issues.  And I love the ambiance and the decor!  First class all the way. Thanks so much for a great lunch.

XwPT30D8ZfqjvgsfbY1k1g.text: Ordered the red curry today.  It wasn't red.  Didn't taste the same, either.  Not too bad, but lots of undercooked veggies and not much overcooked chicken. u0rZP78DU3KJVxvlwCtu0A.text: Always a family favorite for us. Such varied menu!  There is plenty of sushi, thai food, Chinese dishes... Everyone can have their favorite Asian cuisine at Totties!  We will be back soon... Ah. Great service as well.

rI200GX17siNM__VkGGzWQ.text: I am gluten free so Thai & Vietnamese are my favorite ethnic cuisines. A friend who loves this place asked me to go so we went for lunch yesterday right when they opened. QCsroX0tuTH-sd3q7TzrdA.text: Really varied menu and wonderful food. I would recommend!

-HKnqufrrM1oNQKWCtUjZQ.text: Found this little gem around the corner from my boyfriend's house. We were both very happy with the food and the management. Steven was very attentive and gave a lot of insight on the quality time and preparation that goes into making the food here as delicious as it is. We will definitely be coming back.

QmUZHE9bFYTqed3tYQ52rw.text: My second time eating here. Hubby not particularly fond of Chinese food but he definitely enjoyed his Chicken and broccoli. Best fried rice I've ever had. Service was great. Will definitely return.

myAi_8Y-1l3oc6V6ZcHfEQ.text: Was craving some Chinese food tonight and did a search for some in the area and came across Tottie's. It's only about a mile and a half from my house so I figured I'd give it a try for some take-out. I'm really glad I did.  I arrived to a cute little restaurant with some great charm. I was greeted by the hostess and I placed my order for take-out. I ordered the Tom Kha Gai soup with chicken and the Sweet & Sour Chicken with steamed rice. She told me it would take about 10 minutes and there was a cute, relaxing waiting area in the middle of the restaurant I could wait in. They had magazines and a water feature to keep me occupied. About 10 minutes later she brought me my food and check to my little waiting area.   I got home and tried the Sweet & Sour Chicken. While it was good it was very light in flavor but very red in color. Still tasty though. The Tom Kha Gai soup was perfect. Perfect amount of spice (on a 1-7 spice level I choose 5ish). Perfect amount of veggies and chicken. The servings were large to share so I certainly have left-overs.   I can't wait to go back and either eat there or take-out again soon to try other items on the menu.   Great service and very tasty food!

ziC9BL6dQpx3tnqonfcFXQ.text: I was very disappointed with this place. The egg drop soup smelled like a wet dog and looked pretty gross too. I couldn't even bring myself to try it. The egg rolls were ok, they could have been more crunchy. The fried rice was decent. I got the panang chicken curry and the flavor was pretty good. I won't be back here. There are way better places around for Thai or Asian food.

4V3CQYPtzH7EnXwbQUfx7w.text: So, I was feeling a little "meh" today, and decided some Thai soup would magically make me better.   I'm still regurgitating the soup as I write. It was like a Great Sea Monster came in my mouth. Salty, fishy -- though not much fish was actually in the broth -- and just an overall sense of death and despair. I liked the Bunsen burner in the middle of the bowl. It flickered and sent little sparks in the air. It was Tottie's way of evoking hell, and it was pretty ingenious.   I'd describe the color of the soup as "menstrual." A muddy brown-red that complimented the over-cooked flakes of fish. The fish, like so many of us, had just given up. There was no point in being irresistible anymore, swimming in a hot sea of salty discharge.   I waited so long just to flag down the waiter so I could get a glass of water to wash the taste of regret out of mouth. As the minutes rolled by, I thought about things: the brevity of life, how 1 hour and 20 minutes have gone by that I'll never back, if the guy across from me was flirting with me...maybe not. Ok, let's just say he was.   A waitress came at last with a glass of water, which I chugged. She asked if I wanted to take the soup home, but I decided to leave it and have it donated to people who are feeling bad about themselves. I might come back on Ash Wednesday, or  when I need to punish myself, or experience my own personal Apocalypse in the comfort of an Asian restaurant.

FQlXKR97WZ9vuuvksf7seg.text: This place is great. There are a ton of different Asian inspired options. Really decent portion size and constantly delicious.

pXVy9aT8JzQxX7NAHMVYeA.text: Great restaurant. Don't confuse if for Totts in chandler. That place blows.

947GAcUsx7C2TK9XkkgZGg.text: Really good and quite surprising given the location. We thoroughly enjoyed our lunch and stayed for almost and hour. Great presentation and flavor, all around. The service was prompt and accurate. I will definitely be back again soon.

3shwTQTvNIAYF8qllKOZhw.text: Went here with a couple of friends for dinner and really enjoyed the food! We ordered egg rolls, shrimp fried rice, and shrimp panang. The egg rolls were so good, we ordered another batch lol. The fried rice and panang were delicious as well. My friends ordered garlic chicken as well and didn't enjoy that. Other than that, service was good and waiters are friendly.

avwxV9kbgfNSCV7TFbmvXw.text: It is not very often a restaurant exceeds my expectations. But we had such an amazing experience at Tottie's that I felt compelled to write this review (which I rarely ever do). From the delicious pad thai, to the homemade ice cream, to the excellent service - this place is worth it! We'll definitely be back!

usJXdUOkCdz1ZwWfx2bivg.text: This is by far one of my top favorite restaurants in the city! I love love this place! The food is so good, the atmosphere is relaxing and inviting. I could literally eat here everyday. They also have s really decent sake selection and the plum wine is so yummy!

0bXz29fxG-xdKyRIRf9bmA.text: Service was as good as could be expected.  Atmosphere was very nice with elegant lighting and smooth jazz playing or Spanish guitar, thus the Fusion.  Food portions were generous and presented nicely.  Will definitly frequent this place.  Thank you!  Steven

eT8SsLl34ss60rai0Mwx4w.text: Simply awesome! Best Asian food in the area. The service is spot on and extremely friendly. Tottie makes it a point to visit each and every table to make sure everything tastes good and is well done.   The Tottie rolls are to die for and are a must have when going here. I was craving Sweet and Sour Pork, I know lame huh, so I ordered her version.. its just the classic deep friend goodness tossed with fresh pineapple, carrots and onions. Reminded of me Shea Garden my mother used to take us too when we were wee lads.  For dessert we had the Rocky Road ice cream, awesome! She used coconut milk instead of regular milk.. super creamy and delicious. Also tried this pumpkin custard that was so smooth and refreshing.   Of course everything is fresh and home made.. family owned and operated.. this is just a great Asian restaurant. Next time I'm going to try the pho!

_gACr1FQ7Zr5XNJfjjJuLA.text: This is one of the best Asian meals you may ever eat. They are amazingly inexpensive for lunch too. The house fried rice and the wonton soup are perfection. The Lincoln location is prettier but the food is the same.

S246jqby52pZ-hmPfKu40g.text: My boyfriend & I were here tonight. Stephanie was fantastic! The food incredible-- we will now be regulars. Thank you:)

c4hnFqfYJ-m5Sd7V6athBA.text: So after my initial post where my order was  messed up, I was contacted by the owner who sent a lovely email offering me a free meal.  A) how awesome is that?  B) Glad I did!   People and restaurants have 'off' days and I must have just gone there on an 'off' day. It happens.  NOW, I get the hoopla!  So delicious.  My Tom Kom Gai was rich and creamy and had tons of chicken this time.  the Chicken Panang was also outstanding.  Spicy, crunchy vegetables, tender chicken.  This will now definitely be my Thai takeout place and I am now eager to try the sushi as well.  Not only is the food delicious, but a restaurant that goes out of it's way to correct a error?  That's rare and I greatly appreciate it.  Thanks Mark!

4dFCeoSJkNaN__odFm-mug.text: I loved this place. I ordered the green curry medium and it was hotter than I thought it would be but in a good way as the flavor was fantastic. Hubby ordered the beef noodle dish (basically the beef version of pad thai) and his was hot at medium so next time he is going to order mild and just add spice on his own. I will be back as this was the best Thai that I have had in AZ or anywhere for that matter..great new find
