It was delicious. the yellow curry, oops, I should have asked for a curry with coconut... like the green or panang.  my bad. I Truely love this place. Loyal customer for almost a decade and will keep coming back.  it was nice to have dinner cooked for me after I worked so hard.  The owners are pretty cool people and the art and energy they share is awesome. I need to go here more often! Maybe I should apply.  lol

9lCJLb4NkqB-08WLjVvVoQ.text: My sister and I went here for dinner after a recommendation from a friend of her's and I have to say I'm glad we listened. We got the combination appetizer plate which came with an array of different sauces which were all very good (adding a little hot sauce to the peanut sauce was a very good choice on their part). It came with a lot of fried items, the exception being the BBQ ribs which were very tender and juicy with a great, flavorful sauce, and the skewered beef which was a bit over seasoned which I was not a fan of. After we shared the Panang with shrimp. The Panang was very flavorful (their medium is kind of spicy so be wary of that) and was full of vegetables and about a handful of large shrimp. Their Thai ice coffee is wonderful, a very good balance of spice to coffee and cream.  The only thing I can say is really off about this place is the service. While our waitress was nice enough and came by often enough I wonder if she knew that we could hear her scoffing about us while she was standing behind the bar about 10 feet away. I can understand that not everyone likes everyone and that people like to talk about their customers but please keep a professional attitude, at least until you're in the kitchen/back room.

lyVx30vOvmCxOagDU_U_yA.text: We enjoyed the spring rolls and sushi but the tom yum soup was too sweet and strangely tomato based.

UJFAiaso0u2oY-0V3NW4mA.text: Not impressed. The pad thai tasted off  and the panang curry with shrimp was completely devoid of flavor/spice. Only the fried tofu and chicken satay were good and those are pretty impossible to mess up. The search for decent Thai in the valley continues....

_Ck8m-v8aTG2ZAxt_ShWDQ.text: I'm from NYC in town on Vacation checked this place out... Because of yelp reviews and was not disappointed great food and great service. A+++ ... Believe it or not best Pad Thai . I have ever had . Oh yeah and the steamed chicken dumpling awesome

hcN1pSegilppCG_iboz85w.text: I've tried this place twice now and I'm not impressed. The General Tao's chicken is dry and flavorless, despite having thick sauce all over it. wT6qRpArhihSfVoytR-ccg.text: Service was excellent.  Food was alright. We ordered the chicken chow mein and the chicken tasted old and chewy. We also ordered the Kung pao chicken and that was good. I don't think I'll be a regular.

kBcvGt7g1OjDUEGcGpfoBQ.text: I need to add another star to my review. After expressing my disappointment in the service at Tottie's, the owners replied to my email and acknowledged my issues. coWRs1UoZPJ74Fmk8WANHQ.text: Excellent restaurant hands down  This restaurant has not only the food that tastes great and is well prepared , fresh and atmosphere is great. Thanks Tottie, Mike Codere

owAXYaW2ZMb0kB35Ys10qw.text: Yummy asian fusion selection, great service, big portions, and great prices!

Ic6490-u1Z_J84u4TReo9Q.text: I came here not really wanting to spend a lot of money.  You really can't walk out of here for under $10 unless you only get an appetizer and drink water.  I was wanting to try some of the appetizers...but at about ~$6-10/pop....and wanting to get a meal (guessing you could probably do an appetizer as a meal), that wasn't going to happen.  I noticed the "Bun Tom" on the menu...seemed to be a good combo of food and included some "Tottie Rolls" which I wanted to try.  The Meal:  The Tottie Rolls were OK.  Not the best I've ever had...but not bad.  The meal itself...I saw it and wondered...wasn't sure it was that much food.  Well...wow does that food pack down in that bowl.  I think I had somewhere between 3-5 servings out of that bowl.  It was an excellent meal.  The pork mixed with the rice noodles...and the sauce that came with it...along with some of the greens on the plate and the mint leaves...combined to make quite a tasty bite of food.  The bowl itself was never ending.  2 could've probably had enough food out of this (and at that point...I guess the price starts looking pretty good...but wasn't for a lone person trying to eat).  I really should've probably taken half of it home to at least get another meal out of it.  Don't know why I didn't in retrospect.  But it was good.  Very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bun Tom

AQJ9qZaF6LZj3Kx9q8qAhg.text: This review is based on ordering many things from the overall menu over a 1 year period, however one item there deserves a 5 star rating which I will get to  Overall most of the items are fairly americanized and not traditional which you expect from a fusion place - however most items are very average and for the price I do not feel you get good value here   That being said the one item that does stand out here is their Shrimp Tom Yum Soup which i feel deserves 4 if not 5 stars - it is excellent and flavorful, with a lot of shrimp - make sure to order a side of steamed rice with it medium hot, and you will have a stand out dish  In general their soups are solid, but the only thing I have not found better somewhere else is their Shrimp Tom Yum soup  Go for the Tom Yum, get your Vietnamese soup from Khai Hoan down the road a few miles

07wMeBoUxb4d9Q81koGs6g.text: Let me start by saying whatever happened to cooking Christmas dinner? I am Jewish, so for me Christmas= Chinese food, but apparently the secret is out. I went here tonight with the BF. We had made reservations for 7:30 and arrived at 7:20. The place was clearly understaffed as the two hostesses were running around like crazy acting as waitresses and bussers in addition to trying to host. As we stood there waiting for our table, about half of the tables in the restaurant left. You would think that this would make for a quick seating....surprise! It didn't. We waited for about 30 minutes to be seated. Additionally, several tables who did not have reservations were seated at the same time as us, which would have been fine if there were people working at this restaurant, but there weren't. So the BF and I sit there. The couple (without res) gets water, some small family that was seated at the same time gets water....we get nothing. The waitress comes around and takes their orders. Nothing. The family gets their appetizers and the waitress comes and takes their main entree order. Nothing. The other table gets their beers and sushi...still nothing! The hostess finally came by after at least twenty minutes and took our orders....we still do not have water. For real. And the place has gotten significantly less busy at this point. So we order the tangerine chicken and the pad kee mao with a 7/10 spiciness. We waited and waited. The other couple received entrees and just about finished them before we got our food. It was like we were in an episode of Seinfeld or something. The service was that bad.   We (finally) get our food and I will admit, the tangerine chicken was tasty. It was sweet and savory...pretty good. The problem is it was luke warm...like it had been sitting for awhile. Not cool. The pad kee mao was a disaster. First, it had about a 1-2 star spiciness level. Not spicy....at all. Second, in addition to not being spicy it was bland and kind of tasted like dishwater. Third, the veggies were still essentially raw. The dish was terrible. I have had much better (real) Thai food for a fraction of the price. We barely touched the dish, but no one showed us any concern or asked if our food was alright. The entire ordeal lasted one and half hours...for just entrees and water. Overall, the experience was terrible.   I know what you're thinking....But Jennifer, it's Christmas!... Yes, I know it's Christmas, but I don't care, it isn't an excuse. I made a reservation. If they they did not have the space, they should have A) not given us a reservation or B) not let in walk ins when they had reservations. Whoever owns this restaurant should have put more thought into staffing for a night that they KNEW would be busy because they took reservations! It was unacceptable. The place only got a second star because the tangerine chicken was good, but I would be hesitant to go here again because apparently my business means nothing to this restaurant.

imlQ6Zg08CXBhuSusxjTnA.text: Totties is like the #basicbitch of Asian restaurants. Super Americanized Asian food from all over the place. Not bad but not that great.

T00823-R3DI5M3sXy2WWwg.text: I know it was during lunch rush, but it wasn't crazy busy (at least compared to a lot of places at lunch time in Scottsdale) and I told the waiter right off the bat I was on an hour lunch break so to go ahead and bring the food and check whenever they were ready.  The food came relatively fast, but it was overall pretty flavorless (more on that below).  However, it took a while for the check to come. On the plus side, the atmosphere was nice and the place felt pretty clean.  The Food: I am a huge hot and sour soup fan and I was disappointed with the hot and sour soup - I can't quite put my finger on what was different with it, it just was lacking flavor/spice.  The pad thai had a similar issue and was a clump of gummy noodles - I have had better pad thai and I would not personally recommend the food, especially for the price.

ecMZszXbzhpZ-Hk2YwJSAA.text: Dear Miss Manners,  When on a sushi date, is it appropriate to eat the sushi with your fingers? I've read/heard that the Japanese use their fingers. I tried using my fingers, but every time I do I get 'the look.'  It's a look similar to the one my grandmother gives me when she thinks etiquette school was a waste of money because I obviously didn't learn anything. Then, I remind her that I was only 5 when I went to etiquette school and I couldn't even spell my name correctly. I spelled it Mogran for God's sake, like I am going to remember how to dine like a lady.    Anyway, I visited this fine establishment on a date and dropped a piece of raw fish on the table because chopsticks can be a little tricky. I looked at the raw morsel wondering if it was still safe to eat and wondering if they use an old rag to wipe down the tables or a clean bleach soaked one. In my hesitation, my date swooped it up and popped it in his mouth. Should I be weirded out by that? In the future, can I just use my fingers to avoid dropping sushi on the table?    P.S. The sushi was good enough to want to eat off the ground, let alone the table. Not sure if that makes a difference in your answer, just thought you should know.

2X3K7-zHVke3qp0l8aVa8Q.text: Shut up. This place is so friggin good. I've never had Pad Thai before this place and it ROCKS. great happy hour and extremely flavorful food. I live in Tucson and me and my boyfriend have yet to find a place that comes even close to Totties. I'm depressed.... Might have to take a drive to Phoenix soon.

R4Cu56v-sEZiHJncQEsu5w.text: Unfortunately this was not a great visit to this restaurant. The reviews were great and my dining partner is vegetarian and there were many options for her so we thought we'd try it. I ordered the the pad Thai at a medium heat. It came to me TOXIC. I'm accustomed to spicy food, this was inedible. I told the server it was to hot for me and she informed me that the medium there was jalapeno hot, it was way way beyond that. I eat spicy food regularly, this was toxic! She brought back my dish but this time there was ZERO heat. I can't believe there was nothing between 0 and 100! The server never even came back with forks after she took my plate away or asked if the new plate was any better. It was over all a disappointing experience.

Y92vWfZvAX1Ga0NM2iQkHw.text: This restaurant has Chinese and Thai food.  I ordered the spicy eggplant with a spice level of 6/7.  It came out right away and was huge.  The flavors were delicious, but it really could have been much spicier.  I think often waiters don't believe me when I say I want it very spicy.  The prices were reasonable, and I would go back again.  My only complaint was that our waitress didn't return to refill our water glasses until we were finished eating.

INA_0j3tQec70wt0otE3sQ.text: THIS PLACE IS SOOOO AMAZING! Best Thai food I have ever tasted! I always get the chicken pad Thai and is so fresh and delicious! I also love getting the lunch special that comes with egg roll and fried rice! Amazing staff and so nice and polite! Love this place! I normally eat here about once to 2x a week!

fK2-pkFS2ODy5N6u5a5G9g.text: Well I am allergic to bell peppers, I was literally the only person in the restaurant and I explained no bell peppers in the dish that I was ordering llama I was a bit distracted as I started eating, and I realize there was peppers in it, well she said she was going to make one and take care of it, which basically they did nothing, didn't even give me a discount, as I'm breaking out in hives, they said I had to pay for my beer. think about where your food coming from. Never again from this place

eYVJ4_txCdlQJox6eA6M9Q.text: Got a to go order. Lexi the host was amazing! Food was incredible. Only reason I give it 4 stars is because our initial greeter Steven the manager could use some classes in customer service.

pBxV9_yb7LEeWZnQWleQQg.text: Very good food and friendly attentive service. My husband and I were visiting Scottsdale with our daughter and stopped here to eat. I enjoyed their Thai Iced tea very much and ordered the Pad Thai, which was delicious. They serve generous portions, we took the left overs back to the hotel and had them later for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

zzW6Atx-e-Uij2BMTPm2Fw.text: Friendly service, home like atmosphere. Accommodating and timely. Will definitely return, Lexi was a sweetheart.

aHA-n7g-E3UP-kBmZ7X6MA.text: My wife always gets the Lemon Chicken. It is pan fried and very tasty. Added to the chicken is a made from scratch lemon sauce that is the best ever.  Two visits ago, I asked the waitress what the best spicy dish was. Without hesitation, she said Panang. I ordered Panang with beef, 4 stars hot (mid-way between 1 and 7). The flavors were superb, the beef was tender, the vegetables were cooked but still firm, and the heat level was perfect for me.  Since we were in Scottsdale for a limited time, we went twice within a week.    In addition, all of the staff is friendly and want to make sure the food is good and the service is great. What more could you ask from a restaurant.

s11HHunqc0uiRF-BAnzYBQ.text: This is a great Thai place; I had the Lang Leo Wan w/shrimp.  It was so good.  Our waitress was awesome, very helpful with our lack of knowledge of the menu.  We would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Amazing,

v16LiHh24Wt--OztJjDrMQ.text: We came to Tottie's Asian Fusion for lunch.  Fusion in this context does not necessarily mean melding of flavors in the dishes.  Rather, it means the restaurant offers cuisine from different Asian countries: Chinese stir-fry, Vietnamese pho and spring rolls, Japanese sushi, and perhaps the most prevalent, Thai noodle dishes, salads, and curries.  Like the menu, the restaurant is huge and beautifully decorated.  I got the Pad Kee Mao (drunken noodles) with chicken and medium spiciness.  An enormous dish for just above $10, and the noodles and chicken had a nice sweetness followed by a spicy kick.  Good balance of oil and sauce too.  Broccoli still had a bit of crunch left.  Solid 4-star dish.  The Thai fried rice was more of a combination - they threw in shrimp, chicken, and beef with the standard peas, carrots, and scallions.  My wife commented that it actually had a good amount of "wok breath."  Also a $10 dish that can feed two.  Very surprised we were able to finish both dishes.  We were planning on a morning hike, so all those carbs came on handy.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside decorations
Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pad Kee Mao (drunken noodles) with chicken and medium spiciness.  Love that sweet taste followed by a spicy kick. (4 stars)
Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Thai Fried Rice - beef, chicken, and shrimp. Decent Wok Breath (4 stars)

ejueQQyvIdEPfCZ0WtQ-wQ.text: We used to go here all the time. We loved this restaurant, although expensive, it was the best Asian food close by. Last night we got an order to go.  Food tasted terrible, food wasn't cooked all the way, another meal was burnt,  We hate to say this, but we did not like the new cook or the new menu.

l6K4SPIZO7BKax2AsCHPBg.text: My wonderful wife just picked up some carryout menu items from this establishment.  I asked her to request one of my chosen items have a certain ingredient excluded.  Of course, as soon as she returned home, and we opened the food container, there was the one ingredient present plain as the disappointed look on her face.  She said she emphasized this ingredient be excluded.  Because she is in food service herself and would not stand for this mistake, she was out the door faster than a cook not paying attention to a food order.  This now meant her meal would become cold!  Without compromise cleanliness and good service is to be expected when going to any food establishment.  The food may be good but not necessarily to one's taste.  But cleanliness and good service are controllable.  In my opinion that this order was not prepared properly is bad service.  It probably would have tasted fine with the excluded ingredient.  But consider people with life threatening food allergies.  Thankfully I am not one of those people, but the point is valid.  My request was simply a matter of preference.  This establishments cavalier attitude towards ingredient requests is unacceptable.  The remedy was to offer a free dish upon a next visit.  There will be no next visit.  Even if they had offered to pay for the mistake on the initial visit, which they should have (or discounted), there will be no next visit.

Eyere1IqVTxMbKofajb5Jg.text: Totties is a great option for everything Asian.  In one place, I can fufill my cravings for Vietnamese, Thai AND Chinese food! Their menu is extensive but not overwhelming.  I've eaten there twice now and both times I have enjoyed the food.  Lot's of veggie items and good sauces.  I'm definitely a fan!

0v8gJK9UiSGtLCC6r07trQ.text: I just found me my new favorite Thai place! Having lived in The Valley for three years, I've been searching high and low for a delicious Thai restaurant and today I found it! I ordered the Pad Thai with chicken and wow!!! So flavorful and with just the right amount of spice. All I can say is that I'm looking forward to trying more menu items.

AAjlWi4GAPe8c1wL4Zekzg.text: My chicken pad Thai was delicious and spicy. Service was overall good, except for the guy bussing the table. While I appreciate his work ethic, it felt like he was hovering and we felt a little rushed. Honestly I would probably give this place a 3.5 if I could. Good food, descent service, the atmosphere leaves a bit to be desired. Recommend if only to try the food.

YL8CRSOoAIuDyQlcbguIeg.text: I absolutely love Totties. I've been frequenting this place the last 4 years. The service is great, the environment is quiet and decor is beautiful, traditional asian art. Best part: the food is AMAZING! This place never fails me, my favorites are the Chiang Mai noodles and the pad thai, especially thai hot!

-lGTgwYSG-RbGm1xzV3yMA.text: We love Tottie's! We often get takeout for dinner here. I love their pho broth (pro tip, if you're sick and need some great chicken broth, you can buy the broth alone!).  We also really enjoy the Orange Beef or Chicken - which is super flavorful and perfectly crispy. We often get one or the other with a noodle dish or rice.   I recently ordered the Panang Curry with Fried Soft Shell Crab and it was AMAZING - highly recommend!! I couldn't believe how flavorful the sauce was, and the crab was perfectly done. It was incredible.  I also really like the summer rolls with peanut sauce - they are really fresh and the sauce is to die.   Their chow fun, however, is not my favorite.   We just discovered they have happy hour, including sushi, so we'll be dining in soon to experience that, too!

j6rCxhiKEOAlQSGRt4c9pg.text: The receptionist was horribly rude. I came in to order take out and was treated just horribly. There are many other places I will bring my buisness to from now on and I will not recommend this restaurant to anyone . Get some manners young lady!

QGUPJ6shWcc2FW5iyvL81w.text: Went here a long time ago remembered it was pretty good, went tonight and literally got turned away. we got there at 8:40, they close at 9:00 but there were four tables still in various stages of eating.  I know it sucks to show up in the last 30 min but there were people obviously without food yet. No one came out to greet us for 10 min. A kid with long hair comes out and refuses to seat us stating they closed in five minutes.  I asked about all the people seated without food, he said it didn't matter, no apology or further explanation. Not that I want to eat somewhere that is so unwelcoming and rude. Beware, they actually close at 8:30pm.

P8QzsKrBXy921az9xYSIRg.text: Oh no, no, no! I went here for lunch today with my bestie after reading mixed reviews. We live close by and love sushi so...why not? We found out sushi is only served at night. I will look again, but I did not see that noted anywhere on their website. Ok, so sushi is out...plan B. I ordered the shrimp and broccoli with beef added and the mango, sticky rice with coconut milk for dessert. I paid extra for the beef, but didn't think about it until I ate the leftovers at home. NO BEEF!! What? Shrimp and brocolli with beef added...without the beef?  The soup was gross (I can not think of a better adjective). Neither of us ate it. I told the waitress that we didn't want the soup and she nodded and walked away, leaving our full soups on the table for the entire meal. Was it her first day?   For some reason the waitress brought our dessert with our meal!!! I thought about asking her to take it away and bring it when we were finished our meal, but horrible visions of people spitting in my food popped into my head, further spoiling my appetite. So my mango with sticky rice sat there untouched for about 25 minutes, probably collecting dust particles, lint and spit. GROSS!  NOPE. I will NOT be back unless my meal is free.

vNKFGsaBc0Rhs7DSJwkEWg.text: This place impressed us.  The atmosphere is enjoyable,  our waiter was extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the food.  We ordered the spring rolls and chicken panang which did not disappoint.   What a burst of flavors!

-ZZCV20jTMwKnFXjF42-ew.text: Totties is a nice place to go if you aren't looking for authentic Asian food. The flavors are mild in the sense that they don't jump off the spoon into your tastebuds. I usually try each restaurant several times before I review a dish just to make sure they are consistent. I've ordered the Mongolian beef 4 times, each time ordering different levels of spice (on a scale of 1-10, 10 being the spiciest) the meat they use is of low quality and use way too many onions. I recommend ordering extra sauce so you can use all the rice they serve with it. I also suggest the Pupu platter as an appetizer for the table. It has a nice selection of food that is delicious and authentic.

81tK743QdRyl-u-Ft3ukVQ.text: The chicken was great and the service was fast. I was also able to get brown rice which makes me happy!

_eo3U5DUF7zvYcApiIH_XQ.text: When we go in to eat its like seeing an old family member. Tottie and her staff always makes you feel welcome.  Bun Tom is one of my favorites --Charbroiled pork, shrimp and Tottie rolls with fresh lettuce, fresh mint, peanuts and rice vermicelli. Pho Tai is great. Spring rolls are awesome. Depending on time of year she makes the most incredible avocado ice cream. Trust me, its perfection.

ZghV_KK53JoUV5c_kZ2FhA.text: For a place that combines Thai, Chinese, and Vietnamese food into one restaurant, I must admit that Tottie's has pretty good sushi. I was pleasantly surprised.  I only ordered water and few plates of sushi and rolls, but I enjoyed the experience fully. The ambiance is a 10/10, very beautiful interior with great design and architecture. Took a seat at the sushi bar and we were served promptly. The chef is Japanese (I think) and repeatedly insisted to us that "anything is possible". Liked that a lot.  My water was never below halfway--I love this in a restaurant. I prefer not even to be interrupted and asked if I need more water, just do it. Quality if the fish was fresh, too. Nothing smelled or tasted fishy, even the raw stuff. It was great to watch the chef's knife skills over casual conversation, but partway through our meal, he did get very upset and yell at a server which was pretttttttty awkward and not very professional.   All in all, I want to come back and try some of their entrees. I feel like I haven't had the full Tottie's experience yet since I only did sushi, so I'm excited for Round 2, whenever that may be.

GYVyCqHJDtU09_V7rYcHJQ.text: Best Thai food in Scottsdale.  Have been coming here since it was in half the space and had another name.  Tottie is a genius chef and has created the most amazing dishes! The decor is beautiful as well - see the dragon made of Swarovski crystal! Highly recommended!

vY71t-xEuKwJhWOwwlyxKQ.text: Usually very good for Thai. I have been here for lunch a couple times where the food seemed like it was left over from yesterday. I have heard the Chinese at night is great, but I have yet to try it. Other places in Scottsdale are better for sushi.

HDdLEocgt_9MrrzJfAGs6w.text: Not a good experience. Like going to the DMV for lunch.  Apparently it is called Asian Fusion because the food was a fusion of both tasteless and salty.  The art was cool at least.

NLiHCqvIwKxbQif6wE2ViA.text: The best in town. Food is fantastic. Love the curry!!! We eat there all the time. My boys love it too. The service is wonderful and it is always nice to see Tottie. Such a great gift to the community.

SQoQ8o-O9YDLleAF8dyZMw.text: Amazing. Dragonfly noodles with chicken, pho with beef, Las Vegas roll and flaming tuna roll. All exceptional. Service was amazing and quick. Place was also very clean.

EJDNC5Vi166TNoAQomML-A.text: Where else can you go and have Vietnamese egg rolls, shrimp dynamite sushi with Chinese hot and sour soup and thai fried noodles? And follow that up with house made non-dairy jackfruit and avocado ice cream?    That's what so great about this place! You can create the craziest menu and everyone is satisfied.

tt2HElfwPFLTD7TiVmC5KA.text: We live in Gilbert.  This restaurant is always worth the drive.  Delicious, never disappointed!!

8UQCNRUZerwchHSAu_q3Qw.text: I have been to Tottie's on Thomas Rd many times and each experience has been fantastic.  The food is tasty and bountiful, the servers are attentive and friendly, the atmosphere is intimate with far East decor and yet casual and comfortable.  They also have a small list of fruity cocktails, plus a few simple beers and wines.  I have never been to 2nd location on N Scottsdale Rd.  I love Thai food and have had it in many cities across America (have lived in NYC, Miami, Portland OR, Seattle, Chicago, to name a few cities).  There are maybe 3-4 Thai joints that I would give 5 stars, including this place.   This is the best Tom Yum Soup I have ever had.  It comes in one of those big aluminum bowls with the Sterno flame in the middle to keep it hot.  I think Tottie's offers heat at levels 1-4, and then also Thai Spicy (aka level 5).  My wife and I ordered it Thai Spicy.  It definitely packed some heat, but not so much that it burned the taste buds off your tongue so as to ruin the flavor of the dish. For me, it was the perfect level of spicy hot.  And more important, it was super tasty with all the characteristics you want in this spicy and sour soup.  Like all the best versions of Tom Yum, I pulled out fresh chunks of lemongrass, galangal and kaffir lime leaves as I ate.  We had the Seafood option with scallops, white fish, mussels & shrimp (other choices are chicken or just shrimp).  It had a good amount of seafood, very hearty.  The amount was way too much for just my wife and I.  We both had 2 bowls each, and then took about half of the pot home.  I have had the Panang Curry multiple times here.  Panang is my personal favorite type of curry.  I always get the chicken option.  The full dinner order is a huge portion.  I am a very big eater, but ended up taking half of my plate home.  The Panang is also offered as a lunch special option (with about 20 other choices - very inexpensive lunch deals, before 3 PM only).  Lunch special is the same super delish food, but a smaller portion.  And by smaller, I mean I can finish it in one sitting and am quite full.  I expect a lot of people would have left overs ... like I said, I am a big eater.     Other stand outs include Tottie Rolls and/or Spring Rolls with peanut sauce for appetizers, Kang Keo Wan (green curry) with mussels, pan fried noodles, and their traditional Pad Thai.  All of these are wonderfully done.  Oh, and the fried rice is really really good, too -- fluffy and flavorful, not greasy.  I have never tried their Pho or Sushi so cannot comment. I will eventually venture to try more items, but so luv the Tom Yum and Panag that I find it hard to order other items.     FYI - sushi is not available until after 5 PM.  I know because I tried to order it for lunch.  When rejected, I got the Tom Yum soup ... again.   Enjoy!  :-)

TOh1Px-dRiLrg7FdgU9siQ.text: I went here because my favorite Pho soup restaurant was closed. I was skeptical with the word "fusion" on it but decided to give it a try. When I walked in I was greeted by a "tired" looking lady who was trying to be nice but you could tell it was not in her. I ordered the Beef Pho soup and what I got was far from Beef Pho. When it was a clear chicken broth looking soup that lacked many of the traditional flavor of a authentic Pho soup. It honestly tasted like Campbell's chicken soup. The beef was not sliced thin like a traditional Beef Pho instead it was hard and rubbery pieces of beef that had so much gristle inside it that I was unable to eat it. It was a major turn off. I had also ordered pork egg rolls and you guessed it...it had rubbery pork pieces inside it with mushy cabbage. I finally just put my fork down and kindly paid my bill and walked out. While I was there I couldn't help notice that they had a sushi station and that they also sold Thai food, Chinese food, Vietnamese food and Sushi. These are way too many items to have a one restaurant. The problem is that when places like this offer different items they tend to do them below average instead of concentrating of doing one type of food good and this is the case with this place. It tastes horrible, stay away.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nasty Beef Pho from Totties.

Rqq1FzO7NNIDXvdiOvMO-g.text: i still think this is one of the better thai restaurants in the valley. they continue to keep the food consistent, and if you're not feeling thai but still want asian, their menu has plenty of chinese and vietnamese options as well. mid-range price point and everything i've had so far has been absolutely delicious. even the ubiquitous pad thai is really well done and in a huge portion.

AIfsrA9xpit0tqUOq7lvNg.text: Beautiful environment, clean, polite & efficient service, delicious food, aweskme crystal dragon. Tom yum on point

dVO3maa-ghg2_ENy8NyfgA.text: I have had fusion between different "classified" ethnic foods, but this has to be the first time between Asian dishes.  They have a wide array of Asian influences such as Thai, Chinese, Korean, etc.  The secret to their success is how they blend the sauces of different ethnic cuisines.  In addition, they have the ability to pair different Asian foods together in a menu.  They have straight up Thai choices, Chinese, sushi, and Vietnamese dishes as well.  I guess it really depends on what you are feeling.  The prices are very reasonable here for a fusion restaurant.  The place is a little small, but its cozy.  Just in case Totties 1 is full, you can always go to Totties 2 which is very close by!  The service is completed with such care as most Asian restaurants usually don't have.  Usually when you go to an Asian restaurant, you get good food and lousy service.  Here at Totties, you get amazing flavors and great service!

nqvF_uSv7NIyb-iHU9bjqw.text: The restaurant is unassuming from the outside. It looks like just another hole in the wall restaurant in a strip mall.   On the inside, however, it is richly appointed with some of the nicest pieces of Asian art I've seen in a restaurant. I took a few pictures, but they don't do justice to how nice it is in this restaurant. It made for a much nicer and intimate evening with my beloved.  We decided to stick with the Chinese menu. We had the combo platter for the appetizer, the house pan fried noodles, the Mongolian beef, and the black bean chicken.   The appetizer had beef skewers that you cooked over a tiny fiery pot. The fire was a bit too lively, which caused a bit of concern. We liked the dishes, but would have liked a better mix of fried and non fried items. It felt like there were too many fried items.   The pan fried noodles were my favorite dish. They didn't skimp on the meat and shrimp. There was more than enough of the dish to have for leftovers. Sauce had a nice smokey flavor that I really enjoyed.  The black bean chicken wasn't my favorite. The portion was large, and the vegetable were varied, but it seems as though the cook just got a bit too heavy handed with the salt.   As for the Mongolian Beef, it was fine but not what I was looking for. That's not the fault of the restaurant. I loved this amazing hole in the wall Chinese restaurant called Ching Dau in that made the most delectable Mongolian beef. The recipe ran away along with the owners when the closed the restaurant down in the late nineties. This iteration was good with a tangy sauce and plenty of meat, but it's not close to the flavor I have been searching for.   The dish that made the visit worth everything was the fried bananas with homemade ice cream. The bananas had this deliciously crunchy shell, and the ice cream was subtly sweet. I believe it was vanilla, but the flavor was very light, so it was hard to tell.   We will be back to try other items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My wife thought her fortune was cute.

Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Another cute fortune. Although, I dont put any credence in any of this. It&#39;s a fun read for after dinner convos. Life is more than this! =)

pra-9tF7p96kF5MarFnidg.text: I like to order take out from this restaurant. They are fast and delicious. I love that they made food spicy, like real spicy, and use many herbs. They have variety of cuisine, Thai-Chinese-Vietnamese. I usually get Thai food.  Their ginger fish is so delicious. White fish is clean and perfectly cooked. I thought they would put a shredded ginger like typical Thai dish. Instead, they use minced ginger. Love it! I can enjoy the freshness of ginger, snow pea, bell pepper, mushroom, and fish in the same bite.  The pad kee mao with spicy level 5 is addiction. It is like pad see ew with chili and basil. We cannot eating it. I wish they use kai lan, instead of broccoli.  I cannot remember the name of the dish but they use shiitake mushroom. I love these mushroom and it hard to find from Asian restaurant.

It's July freaking hot in Arizona and when my friend which she is regular there order the soup I was laughing at her and just order a salad .  The soup was so delicious and so cool had fire on it  when they brought it  I was so impressed and after I tried it i got why in a hell in July in Arizona she ordered soup . tKL1TFS2alTiPVbKTvoQ8A.text: So excited to write this review because I am so happy I finally found a place nearby that has BOMB pad thai. I am a big pad thai fan and this is definitely the best I've ever had. The flavors are SO good and the portion size is all worth the $12-$13 (I think) it is. (I add chicken) It lasted me 3 meals! I got a spicy level 3 and it was perfect.. little kick but not too much to the point where you don't get to enjoy flabors I haven't dined in here yet but every time I go to pick up, the restaurant is full and it is very inviting.

bU4CeplIcYt0q1y4pc2JlQ.text: Happy Vegetatians: my husband and I went here recently for lunch. As vegetarians we both have challenges finding places that have good flavor options with no meat.   Lunch details: Our lunch was delicious and so well priced! I got the BEST veggie pad Thai I've ever had (and trust me I've done my research)! The service was also excellent.   Price: And the portions were great. The picture on this review is a lunch portion and came with soup, an egg roll and your choice of white or fried rice. For $9.95 I believe.   Spice and flavor: My husband likes things super spicey and I like a little spice. They have a 7 spicey system that actually works for any flavor level!  Plus, their egg rolls are vegetarian! That's so rare! Very happy with our experience. A lunch spot on our list not for sure!

LwrVO6g-qciApOLkNMNkpQ.text: A friend recommended Tottie's to me. I have had better Thai food, elsewhere. The menu has Vietnamese, Thai, and Chinese items. Which is a great variety, however, the Thai dishes we tried were not as good as other Thai restaurants we go to. We started with an appetizer of Tottie's Egg Rolls, they were delicious! They came with lettuce, mint, and cilantro, with an amazing dipping sauce. After the appetizer, we had high hopes for our entree's. The  entrees we ordered, were the Pad Thai and Panang curry. The Pad Thai noodles were so thin, (angel hair like) that they didn't hold up to the sauce and meat. Flavor and spice level was good, however. The Panang Curry was full of veggies, mushrooms, zucchini, peppers, bean sprouts and bamboo shoots, (not what I usually get in my Panang. The gravy was VERY "peanut sauce tasting." Not a great balance of coconut milk and peanut flavors. (A bit too sweet too) I was missing the kaffir Lime, and Thai basil, to off set the sweetness. Anyway, we only tried the two dishes, and were left a bit disappointed. On the bright side, service was great, and the Tottie's Egg Rolls were scrumptious :-)

vUX-4Tm2SwvjwEnqF4GfLg.text: The food is so good! We had green curry with chicken (my favorite part is the grilled eggplant); orange chicken; Singapore noodles with shrimp; and fresh spring rolls with pork and shrimp covered with peanut sauce.  Everything was freshly made, tasted authentic, and had good flavors.  Yummy! The service was great--we had a large party--and staff were very attentive.

yHyYIXd2ic7u4w5acS-kuA.text: Years ago we went many times and always enjoyed it.   Hoping to recoup the previous experiences we went recently and were very disappointed. The spark in the food quality is gone now.   I don't know if the ownership or the chefs changed, but the food isn't what it was.   I'd award it a ho-hum now.

oOI407E3tgJVxju4OZk18A.text: This place was pretty good. Nestled away in a Scottsdale shopping complex, you'll find a nice Asian fusion restaurant. The location is out of the way and not luxurious or private to pull up to and park. It's like a shopping complex.   It wasn't too busy when we went around 7pm for dinner. Our server was nice and she was just attentive enough for us to enjoy the meal among our group of friends.   We started with a Saki, of course, and it was pretty great. Price was decent, about 8 bucks, but on the higher end. For food I enjoyed a Pad Thai with chicken and (like a baby) NO spice! Haha I did get it on the side and added the chili flakes and oil on my own.   The Pad Thai was pretty good compared to the other places I've been. The portion size was big and it had a good portion of noodles to chicken to veggies. There was a really cool flaming appetizer someone had at another table which I wished we had tried but didn't get too.  I'd definitely come back and enjoy a meal here again with friends. The setting is casual, service is good and so is the food!   (Not, I forgot to take a pic BEFORE mixing my Pad Thai - so the original presentation was much better than the photo)

f-UqpqEdnHl80bPnFIpn3g.text: Hi we found this amazing restaurant over a year ago and we love it so much the 1 st day we went our server was nice and very helpful!!! Come to find out she was the owner of this restaurant we fall in love with this place thank you tottie for being so heart warming love Luna and sol !!!

CHN1LhriD5L5MzgGNTizcA.text: We kind of randomly picked Tottie's last night when we were in the mood for Asian food, because it's really close to my boyfriend's house. We almost went to SumoMaya or one of the other places we knew about, but I'm so glad we picked Tottie's instead. It is so delicious, and you get a ton of food for the price. We normally eat a lot, but we still have another meal's worth of food leftover (if not more!).   We got the Vegetable Fried Rice, Sesame Chicken and Soft Shell Crab with Curry. The plate of fried rice was humongous; we'll probably be able to have leftovers of this more than once. It was very well flavored and had a ton of veggies in it. The curry was also great, and it came in a huge bowl! The crabs were cooked very well. I'm not huge on that kind of seafood, but I still enjoyed it. The Sesame Chicken was my favorite - fried and crispy, and they had a perfect amount of sauce on it. A lot of places seem to leave their chicken too saucy or too bland, so that was great.   We'll definitely be going back here again, or will probably order it in the next time we want Asian food :) I would definitely recommend this place next time you're in the mood for Asian!!   I also got a really great fortune in my cookie lol ;) it was a nice ending to a good time out.

wKyuZ5B159TsmUAabBsKcw.text: BACKGROUND This is my second visit to Tottie's Asian Fusion and both times it was Mom's choice, including yesterday, for Mother's Day. Although I stand by my original review, both visits were solid, fast, and very service oriented, without being obtrusive, so I thought I'd update my review. TOTTIE'S ASIAN FUSION Tottie's Asian Fusion is owned and operated by Ms. Tottie Kaya, who is also the chef. Ms. Kaya learned from her mother's multi-cultural catering business in Laos as a child, and brought her knowledge and skills to Scottsdale. Ms. Kaya's definition of "Asian Fusion" is bring together the best of Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, and Japanese cuisines, all under one roof, at affordable prices. THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE I'm always sad about this restaurant being in this strip mall. I just feel that the outward appearance may be a turn off for the clientele the restaurant deserves. Both visits were Mom's choice; she likes Tottie's. The inside is all done up "Asian" style, with altars, dragons, faux flowers, etc; it's cute and cozy, but not fancy. There is a sushi bar in the middle, but every time I've been, sushi was not available, and the sushi bar looks like it hasn't been used in a while. We were seated at a booth, and Lexy was our server. It was quite busy for Mother's Day, and they did a great job keeping up. We tried the traditional spring rolls and chicken satay for appetizers. The spring rolls were good. The chicken satay was a bit chewy. Both were served with a delicious peanut sauce. We had the chicken chow mien, red chicken curry, and shrimp with lobster sauce. All were served family style with HUGE portions. My red chicken curry was very tasty, but I was disappointed there weren't any potatoes in the sauce. Everything was quick and delicious. The staff was friendly, but not trying to be our friend; just perfect. CONCLUSION I've only tried the Indian River Plaza location, so far. Although the strip shopping center is not my vibe, once inside, the atmosphere is very charming, and the generous portions of delicious food will win over even the harshest critics. We will definitely keep coming back. 4/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *Two Scottsdale locations: Indian River Plaza, Lincoln Village Shops *For more information: tottiesasianfusion.com ****************ORIGINAL REVIEW*************** ************************************************** Tottie's Asian Fusion was good food in a strip mall. THE FACTS I'm going to just boil it down: * I quite like the "Asian Fusion" concept. * I have no clue who owns this business. * I've heard there are other locations. * It's in a so-so location. * It's in an unappealing strip mall. * The front of the restaurant is nice. * It's clean and cute. Nothing too special. * The staff is friendly. * They have a wide variety of food choices. * Not everything on the menu is available. Ask first. * There is a spicy choice from 1-7. 5 was very spicy. * The portions are huge. * The food is delicious. * I had the edamame and pad thai with shrimp/chicken. * No prik nam pla. An excellent substitute upon request. * It was fairly fast. * Not everything comes out at once. CONCLUSION 4/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE * Plenty of Free Parking * Hours: Closed on Monday, 11am-9pm Daily

yne7twdrarbVd6mQMMuDSw.text: We tried this place on a whim - and liked it so much we came back about two weeks later. As suggested by the name, it is an Asian fusion restaurant, so they prepare Chinese, Vietnamese and Thai food. If you like these kinds of foods you are bound to find something you absolutely love here, and if you don't like Asian food... well, that's pretty unlikely.  On our first trip we tried the appetizer combo plate and pan-fried noodles, and on our second trip we had the pan fried noodles (again), fried rice, and sweet and sour soup. On my next trip I'll probably try the pad thai or the curry, both of which have great reviews. On both occasions the portions were huge with plenty left over for two people's lunch. If you're feeling like some sake, I tried a fruity kind and loved it but can't remember the name.  The service here is great. They greet you at the front door, are prompt with orders, and make sure everything is good and drinks are refilled. You couldn't really ask for much more in your dining experience. I definitely will be back.

jKiOSGgx1_4fA77eV5eETg.text: Coming from New York, this is not Asian fusion. This is American fusion food. Everything we ordered had a weird flavor to it.

dKYyLo_VItQdGCdvL6DqPw.text: Great spot if you want a variety of Thai/Chinese food. Servers are friendly and know their menus well. They are very flexible with removing/adding certain foods to your meal. The Pho is my fave! The smell in the restaurant is a bit potent, not sure if it's just the mixture of foods or if I'm just super sensitive to it, but it's the only turn off I experience during my visits here. Get you a hottie and come to Tottie's!

TKpTmYuSxiaSubxqusBM7w.text: I love this place! I found Tottie's through coworkers. Tottie is the sweetest! She always remembers me. They have great lunch options that are very affordable, as well as a full menu served at all times. Tottie's is closed on Mondays which is a bummer but there are plenty of other days you can visit her and eat her amazing food! There are other locations, however, this is by far the best one! Thank you Tottie!

aYCe1Qvt350lPIMpjCU48w.text: WOW! Their Chicken Pad Thai was to die for and my friend loved her Pho. The whole restaurant smelled delicious in a spacious and welcoming environment. I am excited for the next time I get to come back, and the portions are a nice size to have a happy amount of leftovers!

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pad Thai with chicken

Hs4ly6yIhY7dhjnYf2bjSA.text: One of my favorite places in Scottsdale to grab some pad Thai or shoji noodles and a Thai iced tea.  The place is set back in a strip mall setting. When you walk in you will notice the love of elephants because they are everywhere. The restaurant is kind of quiet but the service has always been excellent.  I love that there is so many different Asian cuisines to choose from.  I had a taste of their Roger roll the last time I was there and was happy with the quality of sushi although not a large variety but still a good menu. The staff was very accommodating for my sister who is a vegetarian too. This is a great place to have a quiet intimate meal, business meeting, or group get together.

UpJFNM_YOIGfpD1lw5bjCw.text: Tottie's is great if you are looking for some variety in your menu. The ambience is great - nice and relaxed. The building is always clean and the staff is always friendly. My favorite is the beef and broccoli. Heads up - if you like some heat they will accommodate you, but be advised, their hottest level isn't for the faint-hearted.

5svw_1Ra7___xXg5Fy4gTA.text: Totties... I've read the 24 reviews that came before mine over and over, and I have to say, it was even better than expected!  Picture this: Sunday evening - dark and cold outside.  Hanging inside with fiance and future sister-in-law.  All of us feeling tired and hungry but too lazy to cook dinner.  Just watched Grey's Anatomy and Private Practice reruns and worked up appetite...  Thai food?  I suggested to them - oh yeah, we can't do that... none of the thai restaurants are open on Sundays.  Damn.  Vietnamese maybe?  Nope - the closest one I could think of was closed on Sundays also.  Chinese?  Too bad we don't have a great Chinese restaurant close by in the new 'hood anymore.  I know, let's try somewhere new... Totties!  I called to make sure they were open, and sure enough - not only were they open, but they are not even a mile away!  Perfect...  Tottie's was awesome - it was nicer inside than I imagined - for some reason I had in my head that it was going to be like Pei Wei - but it wasn't at all.  We were seated immediately and Kethy was our server (yes, Kethy - not Kathy).  She was cute and had personality - something you don't always find in restaurants now-a-day.  She honored our request to start with a big bowl of egg drop soup and add wontons to it!  With the soup on the way, we perused the menu... I love that Tottie's offers Chinese, Thai, Vietnamese, and sushi too!  We mixed it up a bit and ordered Pad Se Ew with Beef, Moo Shu Chicken, Thai Basil Stir Fry veggies, and steamed vegetable dumplings.  Medium spice and light on the oil.  It was way too much food, but it was fun to share a bunch of dishes, and now we have leftovers for dinner tonight!  **Pad Se Ew was the favorite dish of all but nothing we ordered was disappointing.  Total bill for all of the above was $43 before tip... not bad considering the amount of food we had!  Service was attentive - not only from Kethy, but Tottie (I think) came by, and our waters were fill constantly too.  I will totally return to Tottie's in the near future whether it be for Chinese, Thai, Sushi, or Vietnamese - or a combo... oh, and I'll have to remember to save room for the avocado ice cream next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Tottie's Asian Fusion - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

jUoEtjvamfRqsuaB7efRrQ.text: Came here on a Sunday and found out they don't have the lunch combo .  So I ordered one order of egg roll (4 pcs for close to $7!) , and crispy chicken with Thai basil . My friend ordered chicken with cashew .  Egg roll was good . Freshly fried and crispy.  there is no crispness to my chicken . Could barely taste or see the basil . The plate is full with unnecessary crispy noodle .   Not completely convinced I will come back .

LJKgcruU5oA4NC9WANHvWg.text: Had a late lunch here on Sunday 2/15. I was one of maybe 4 tables and despite the food being above average, the service was pretty slow to nonexistent. No check-ins to refill my water in the 40 minutes I waited to get my meal seemed odd. I would give it another shot though. Could of just been an off day or new server.  Update: I thought I should note that Owner Mark contacted me within a day of my review to address my less than perfect experience. This in itself shows how much pride he takes in providing top notch food and service. I have changed my review from 3 to 4 stars in recognition of Mark's commitment. Thank you Mark.

5DhT3aqbSnSY1OXLFLOVJQ.text: This is my second time coming here and this place is bomb!! It's a very casual,low lighting atmosphere with lots of heaping portions of food selections... NQWgSB4a_grYOwUq0yfZ_A.text: This place is one of my new favorites! I love their chicken larb. Seriously great! The place is beautiful, too. I recommend it to anyone who enjoys Asian-style food.

PC_hie2JJwPZG1E0RF3YGg.text: Beautiful place, wonderful staff! Love the atmosphere! My friends and I decided to order from the lunch special menu which was very generous amount but food was some what lackluster! Some entree didn't have much salt and the spice level was mediocre!

1clvaKbc6KeCbIopzi5wrA.text: So I'm not sure how this place gets a 4 star rating on Yelp but when you look at specific entrees at least for chinese entrees they're all "not bad" type of reviews.  But I had a pot sticker craving so I ordered a few items that seemed decent per reviews.  The guy said 15-20min but it took 40 minutes.  The pot stickers (which I got pan fried vs steamed) were actually more like deep fried.  The sauce is more sweet, not vinegary.  Not terrible but out of 6 there was about 2 that had a decent amount of filling, the rest had about a tablespoonful in a dumpling that is about 4 inches long and 3 inches tall.  The taste of the filling and the dumpling dough was good, just poor proportions and a bit greasy.  The sweet and sour chicken was bright pink and more onion than anything else.  Overall somehow the dish was bland.  The rice that came with it was soggy - too much water.   The pad see ew noodles were overcooked and clumped up into small cubed bits.  The flavor wasn't bad, but overcooked noodles really ruins a noodle dish.  Judging as these entrees that had decent ratings were not very good I don't think I'll be returning.

sa_QPPT6wGYRRVd5ORghtQ.text: Fresh big pieces of chicken in the chicken fried rice. Great wait staff. Everyone is very friendly. Decor is modern Asian. Is it odd to say I like the restroom? It's roomy & clean.

-Uc9jcfqrQkFMKd9Jm1_aQ.text: My family ate at Totties Saturday evening. We ordered 4 entrees and 2 appetizers. Food was fresh, well prepared and delicious. Service was highly attentive. Waiter was knowledgeable, providing info to ensure we would enjoy our meals. Atmosphere was cool, clean, tranquil and most enjoyable.

Gt83SFYhmE1xueXuYeChjA.text: The food was delicious as always, but what was even more amazing was DOUG! Saying he was "knowledgeable" and "friendly" would be understatements. He knew the menu and ingredients like the back of his hand, and was able to recommend some great stuff. Not only did he know his shit, but he anticipated our needs and made sure we had everything we needed and more before we ever had to ask. Our bellies were full from the wonderful food, wallets in check because of the amazing prices, and service was on point. Thanks Doug! We'll see you all again soon.

nzIfwlJbEu9GpEw3NGKN4Q.text: Yuk! I've had lunch there but never dinner.  Tom Kha Gai was passable but if there was chicken in there it was in the broth.  Mongolian Beef was a pile of mush.  How does beef get mushy?? So little flavor I added soy sauce and a healthy dose of chili oil.  The brown rice looked and tasted like white rice cooked in dirty water.  Don't even think about the lemongrass stir fry.  It was gritty and tasteless.  Save you money...awful!!

SuuoOmlzpV-YJZgS0fj23A.text: The server was nice, but the chicken in both mine and my wife's dishes (both were different except for chicken) tasted funny. We told the waiter and the cook. We didn't eat the meal but were charged full price. Never again.

YNqZ4Cj-XVOnTTq5NT_Ngg.text: I was expecting so much from Tottie's.  The entire experience was very unwelcoming and just lack authentic flavor in the dish we ordered.  Known as a Asian Fusion, I thought  would be a fusion of flavors, however they have a Japanese, Thai, Vietnamese and Chinese menu...not really a fusion.    The staff was somewhat obnoxious.  I overheard, one staff member tell our waitress, in a snobby tone, "They just want water" It was hot outside and yeah I would like some water to start off.  I would've gotten a drink but after hearing that, why bother. Staff members were later talking really loud about their lives and stories and was just really put off by it.   The menu was overwhelming.  There were special Tottie's dishes which didn't have a description of it was. I asked about the Dragonfly dish, and what type of noodles they were.  The waitress started giving us an education in noodles in a rude tone.  I was just taken back and annoyed that I really wanted to just walk out.  I just wanted to know what it was.    We ordered an order of Tottie's Rolls and Pad Thai.  The description of the egg roll, said it may be the best you ever had.  When the dish arrived to our table, the bottom of the egg rolls were soggy and the meat inside was soggy and really wet.  Therefore, I can only assume these were frozen and placed into a fryer that wasn't at the right temp.  They lack taste and still doesn't compare to my mother's Thai recipe.    The Pad Thai was really wet and really sweet and didn't taste like Pad Thai.  Probably the second worse pad Thai dish I've ever had, next to Pei Wei. All in all we've had better, service and food.  I would recommend going somewhere else.  For two individuals that are Asian and have friends/family that have restaurants, we were far from being impressed.

XrBfWjBPb240vS_i6VYwTA.text: We ate here at lunch and it was my first time.  I had never heard of the place before.  The food was good.  I ordered something in a language that I don't know.  I think it was some sort of Thai curry chicken dish with some other stuff in it.  It came on rice with an eggroll and egg drop soup.  I enjoyed it.  What I liked most is their spicy scale for their food...  1 to 7.  Usually places go hot, medium or mild or even a 1 to 5 scale.  But their 1 to 7 scale impressed me with such a wide range of spicy delight.

VSzh2kDRZrQQIWvemw1vhw.text: The perfect local spot for a great meal. The atmosphere is always welcoming and the service is always superb. The House Lo Mein is my all-time favorite dish, and the egg-drop soup is awesome! Love everything about the Thomas location. I recommend this place to anyone! 5-Star!

UqAG__jdaMGpIIT46JNmzQ.text: Totties was on a short list given to me by one of my college buddies of places to eat in town that fit my budget.  Back at UA we had a chinese restaurant right on the edge of campus for 3 of our 4 years. They had delicious chow-fun, thick noodles with great texture, a thick sauce that could be blended with curry powder upon request. Tons of noodles, with thin sliced steak in every bite that was so tender.  Tottie's Chow-fun was a bit of a letdown. The sauce was watery and lacking any deeper flavors. No notes of garlic, ginger, or deep soy flavor. It was almost broth like and picked up the favors from the overwhelming amount of sprouts. There was minimal beef as well, it tasted as if this has been stewed separately and didn't really flow with the dish. The noodles were also way too thin!   The sauce for the steamed dumplings was way off. The balance was cloyingly sweet and had little vinegar or citrus notes to balance it out. While the exterior was perfect, the pork filling was under seasoned and generally not enjoyable.  I know I'm being hard on this place. Perhaps its because I was out of sriracha sauce? Maybe, but this ran me nearly 20$. The hype is not real.

a1GKJZbsrpqE0uLVy5Q1Ag.text: Great atmosphere with pleasant staff. Although the food is flavorful and delish, the last 2 times I ate here, I ended up with bad migraines...I'm guessing from MSG. The first time it happened, I made sure when I went back to request specifically that they not add MSG, and yet my head was still pounding again after that next meal. If their food is going to have that type of effect on me, unfortunately it's not worth it. Luckily, their Thai iced tea doesn't hurt me one bit, and I'll occasionally run in and get one to go.

5FBTRYz0Ol_ldnZBwJxQMQ.text: From the outside it is totally understandable to have a different idea about what this place has ti offer. Walked in and it was totally different from what i pictured looking from the outside.   Very nice, low lighted and nicely decorated place. Service was awesome and the menu/drink selection is nice as well.  Everything was delicious no complaints and all just that i did not have any room left for dessert(which i picked out even before i picked my entree).. fried plantain with coconut ice-cream, people.  I will be back for that damn dessert. believe that.

zusgfyxWG4HOyhM4Q8s8bg.text: The food is ok, but I have experienced better Asian food. My sweet & sour was way to sweet, and my fried rice just seemed cold and stale. The edamame was greasy and didn't seem fresh at all. I doubt I'll come back here again, except they are open on Sundays and it's hard to find a restaurant open on Sundays.

aS9YK1YJ_2YhT79V1l2q8Q.text: I was in Scottsdale for a week for business and was yelping restaurants for lunch and this little place came up.  I've eaten here twice:  once to go, and once dine-in - both for lunch.    I was very busy the first time so I took back some Kung Pao.  It was pretty good, but possibly the least spicy I've ever had.  The second time I went with 3 other coworkers that same week because I wanted to give some appetizers and other dishes a try.  We ordered the chicken lettuce wrap (aka "Sugar Cane Chicken") for appetizers, tried the hot & sour soup, and ordered the Beef Pad Kee Mow.    The chicken lettuce wraps were very good and also fun to make.  They bring in a miniature grill with flames and all, where you can warm your chicken, before putting it in the lettuce, mint, noodles, cucumber and cilantro.  Very tasty too!  The soup was nothing to write home about, but I didn't really expect it to be.   The Pad Kee Mow was actually very good.  I ordered it spicy, and again was surprised at how little spice was in it.  It was great but could have been more spicy.  They need to utilize a different rating system: Medium, Spicy, and Extra Spicy.  I go to Thai places in OC where the "medium" spice blows away Tottie's "spicy."  This doesn't mean I didn't like it, it's just that I love the spice, baby.  I highly recommend going here for lunch.

j8V1EKi7Nmc05AKxDLiTlQ.text: This is  the best Asian restaurant in town! Previously Shanghai Palace, this out of the way restaurant serves up some of the best curry and pad Thai, that I have ever tasted in my life! The Panang Curry is so savory and aromatic, literally one of the best things I have ever had. I honestly crave this dish about twice a week. Also any thing on the menu can be made vegetarian this is a huge bonus for all veggie's around town!  The Chef-owner Tottie Kaya, is always very hospitable. She walks around to each table making sure everything is up to standard. I have never once had a bad experience at this delicious eatery. So if you love Asian cuisine, you must dine at Tottie's!

tkKWawzgUXeH-OjshdNRCA.text: Updated 4/13/2008  I've been back to Tottie's three times since I first reviewed it, and its gotten better with every single visit.  Tonite was no exception.  Panang Curry: Must have if you do curry.  The vegetables are cut with care, and done to perfection.  Bamboo shoots, squash, and all. Tofu is great.  Chicken is fantastic, too.  The beautifully grown basil garnish could be the best part, too.  I love basil, and if you do too - you're in luck.  Tonight my basil was purplish green with a dusting of silver.  Pad Kra Pao: Must have, too.  Stir fried chicken w/Thai basil in chili sauce, onions, red bell peppers & bamboo shoots.  Again, the vegetables were sliced and prepared with great care.  Excellent fragrance. Large portion.  Edamame. 3 bucks & change.  Always nice.  Do yourself a favor, too - and get the ice cream.  Tonight there were 10 custom flavors.  Peanut Butter, Lychee, Ginger, Apricot... can't remember them all. Our choice: Avocado.  Out of this world.  And the wafer? To die for.  As Roland W. recently wrote, I'm still somewhat up in the air, too, but tonite's performance may have convinced me that Tottie's is figuring out their new groove, and gettin' it.  I'll be back - for sure.  And every other time it's gonna be the Panang, too...  (Below is my earlier review posted from earlier this year: 2/08/2008)  Also going to mention that this place was formerly known as Shanghai Palace.  Same owners, new restaurant is twice the size.  So what is Tottie's take on Asian Fusion?  Chinese, Japanese, Vietnamese, and Thai.  Not really fusion, though... They just have a large menu that includes all four different cuisines.  While I've only visited once, and it was for lunch, I was disappointed to discover that the lunch specials are limited to Chinese dishes.  I went in hoping for Thai and had to settle for Kung Pao Chicken.  Additionally, there was only one vegetarian option on the lunch menu, and there are few veg options on the regular menu.  I will say that the lunch portion was well above-average in size, and it was good, however the hot and sour soup was a little iffy...  In conclusion, I'm looking forward to giving Tottie's another shot for some Thai food, but I won't be returning for the lunch special anytime soon... nice place, though!  And the owner is nice, friendly, and approachable!  Cheap for lunch, too!... if you like-a the meat.

u5soqkm8vgWQLz02PC3e6Q.text: I'll preface my review with I lived in Malaysia, so think I have a pretty good grasp of Asian cuisine and the various menu options that other Asian restaurants can offer in the area. I consider myself fortunate to have many meals here, and this review is long overdue.  9 or 10 times now, Kelly has been our server and she is always nice, very knowledgeable about the menu and willing to help and offer an opinion, especially since I now cannot tolerate an extremely hot/spicy dishes. She helped me navigate the "heat" ratings so that I can get the flavor without the pain.   Can you find cheaper? Absolutely. And it will taste of it too. And if you want a dine and drive, there's one down the road with a drive-thru. That's not this place. Tottie's is a gem in the neighborhood, Kelly and the rest of the staff are very friendly, the food is very good and the atmosphere is classy and comfortable.  Good food, good sushi, and reasonably priced! We will be back.

mfh2l6TdyVG22wwWYKYOCA.text: I go here about once a week... whether it's to-go or sit down.  my week is not complete without it.   The menu is expansive - pages and pages. You could get lost in there. Japanese, Chinese, Vietnamese, Thai...  I have tried their sushi and I loved it.   But what I go for - what makes a bad day a good day - are their tottie rolls and their pho tai.  Their Tottie Rolls make Fate's Spring Rolls seem bland and amateurish. (yes, I said it.) The sauce is tangy, the ingredients are so fresh. You can smell the mint as soon as the waitress sets it down on the table.  ahhhhh.   Pho is an obsession of mine. And their are MANY places in the valley that serve. I enjoy totties' because the meat is so tender and the broth - so aromatic. The fact that it is walking distance from my house and it's a cheap $7 meal makes me very happy.   To-Go service never takes more than 10 minutes and the reception area ladies are always polite, courteous and fast. Plus, they never forget the hoisin - which is very important.    The service in general is extremely friendly and attentive. I ask for something - it appears in seconds. The fancy decor makes it safe to bring family (my mom is a new fan), colleagues, and dates.   Try their homemade ice cream. It will not disappoint.   Tottie herself is always doing the rounds. She seems to recognize all the regulars and makes you feel at home. We were there on what I think was her birthday once. She stopped by and gave us slices of her birthday cake. She is genuine and her menu is a testimony to her talent. Good for her!  And good for me - because I live next door to enjoy.   :)

c680emA7EAMO1FwaIjuUeQ.text: Dryer than any other Asian food I've had in my life. Had the chicken and broccoli and was god awful. Took forever to chew 1 piece.

3I3kyMnKQuUGiE_PtJr8qw.text: Good flavors, good entrees.  Sometimes it's not entirely clear which style a dish is going to be in, which can lead to interesting mishmashes.  Friendly service.  9/10 ... Given what it is.

9Vxz43AbSkFnn_NZ_lqloA.text: Everything Thomas said it was and more. I'm not a food mixer. I was afraid to have mint touching my spring roll. But, I was guided on how to put the mint and cilantro together ( what a combination!), I never knew spring rolls could be so delicious!  Everything we ordered came out yummy, even the stuff we didn't order (poor waitress, first day and she was completely lost!)!  I wanted someone to guide our waitress.   But other than that food was yummy, conversations was funny, and I filled my tummy!!  He he!

E5kYDdAZ45c5FsENBnpUjw.text: We love this place!  This is definitely our favorite restaurant. We make the trek from Mesa almost every weekend, it's that good.  Even with the skyrocketing price of fuel we don't mind.  Tottie treats us like family now, so welcoming and accomodating.  Even when we show up not long before closing we are given the same excellent service and food.    The recent addition of the sushi bar has been great too, we never thought the place was lacking anything before they remodeled but they've gone from strength to strength.    We recently stopped eating meat, but that doesn't cause a problem here as they have so many different choices and will gladly accomodate any special dietary requirements.  Great lunch specials during the week as well, this place has it all.

4TilauzGZJcULRh5kw-tPA.text: I love Tottie's!!  I even came to the restaurant for my prom "date" night.  I have been to this restaurant several times for special occasions or birthday parties.  My favorite drink there is the Thai iced tea, but their regular iced tea is also extraordinary.  This is by far my favorite restaurant.  The owner is very warm and sincere.  She even comes by the tables when she isn't cooking to greet her customers.  The food sometimes is a bit pricey, but the food is worth it.  It is authentic food, not overly processed soggy asian food you get at some other places.  If you are wanting to go to have REAL food, with quality service and a nice atmosphere, go to Tottie's.  :)

Tw9yyo0XIXCQ7LaTIwKuLA.text: Shanghai Palace, better known to her regulars as simply "Tottie's," is Asian Fusion fused in all the right places. She holds her food up to the highest standard and will give you a hard time (personally) if you try to subvert that effort.  My favorite story is of when my roommate (GUILTY - we lived at San Tropez apartments and walked there three of the six days that place was open) went to get some soup "to go" and she made him sit there and enjoy her soup, refusing to put it in a styrofoam container to go. "You eat here. Too much trouble. Soup TOO good TO GO. Tastes better sitting down..." Tottie: You rock my socks! Since visiting Shanghai Palace, I've been comparing every Thai, Chinese and Vietnamese restaurant to it. And i fear I'll never stop.  Momentous taste-flavor sensations:  The Spring Rolls ...any of them Tom Ka Gai Mongolian Beef Curry Chicken Sweet & Sour Chicken

jeW18FbbPiFy1q_i19sqjw.text: It is hard to find a decent Asian restaurant in the Scottsdale neighbourhood. We usually pop in when we are back in Scottsdale for our vacation. Unlike other Asian restaurants that seems to have disappeared the next time we are back.   Although the sushi seems to be popular with their customers, we have stuck with the soup and noodles. Tried their wonton, hot and sour soup. Both are generous serving and very delicious. We went overboard in ordering the highest scale - No 7 - spicy for the Pad Thai which was too spicy. Next time will order No 3 or 4 spicy. Chicken cashews and shrimp fried rice were really delicious.  Will definitely visit it again the next time we are back and hopeful it will be there for many more years to come.

nKl6NImzT_zzxR1Rni3b-g.text: I have been here a couple times. The first time I went it was still under the Shanghai Palace name. I heard that Shanghai Palace was the only place in town that had soup dumplings. When I went I turned out the place changed hands to Tottie. Well I had already made my trip there from the air port. My friend who was with me who is also a chef decided to try out some of their dim sum and some apps. The dim sum items were over steamed and were dried out on top. Even the eggrolls were horrible. We noticed the sushi bar and the millions of items on the menu. I would never order something that not the specialty for the restaurant. I mean yeah asian fusion is good when done right but this place is far from that. It is just a bunch of different types of Asian food and non of it is fusion just traditional done wrong!  The second time I went I decided to give them a shot. I heard their Pho was good. Although I think Tottie is a Thai specialty. Well I have to say that not only was the service mediocre and we had to keep asking for water, I found a long, I mean real long, knotted hair in my pho. Of course I find it at the end of my meal and I nearly threw up on the table when I pulled out the hair from my mouth.   Not only is the food horrible, it's dirty and service sucks. I can handle bad food if the place was clean and they had good service. I don't think I ever saw any of the staff wash their hands after touching their hair, face or what not before serving food. Gross. You will never see me back here again. This might be a harsh review but I gave them 2 chances.

SAVZL4KBFcIUVCckvnow6Q.text: Went in for lunch to check out the place; yelp claimed 4 stars. Atmosphere was okay; had radio on pop playing a bit loud - so just an American ambiance. The restaurant wasn't busy for lunchtime though. Ordered Pad Thai chicken lunch plate. The eggroll was barely warm but burned, saturated with oil, and had no flavor; it obviously had been precooked and sitting around waiting......for some time. The fried rice was horrendous. NO FLAVOR at all and mushy (was this Asian food really?).  The Pad Thai chicken had no flavor and the noodles for too thin and mushy.... OH and the soup! Had Hot and Sour soup - it was atrocious; Sweet and like jelly. Maybe that is the 'fusion' they are talking about?  I told the waiter when asked how it was "okay" as we had just started and he said, "oh." My husband's food was equally horrific if not worse. We left most of the meal on the plate when we left and no one cared to ask. If you want bland fast food type American food then this is the place for you; but honestly, go elsewhere.

7kcca9I6sjlevnXm2hStFQ.text: NOTE: This review is for their Chinese selections only*  Two words: Taste-Less. My wife and I tried this spot for the first time based on a friends recommendation and the helpful reviewers found on Yelp. I had a hankerin for some Chinese food, and with all the great reviews, why not?  I'll tell you why not: the Chinese was pretty darn gross. I cannot comment on their Vietnamese, Thai, or Japanese selections, but based on what we had, I will NEVER eat Chinese here again.  Both the House Special Chow Mein and the Kung Pao Beef were odorless, flavorless, and unappatizing. Soy sauce was no match for the lack of deliciousness found in these items. Noodles, meat, veggies, everything was BLAND.  We were so hungry I found myself devouring the small container of white rice we received. And the Tottie Rolls??? Flavorless as well. What's goin on Yelpers???  I'm not gonna say Yelp has let me down, as most of the reviews here are for other items on the menu, but we will seriously reconsider this destination the next time we are in the mood for some Asian food, and if we do go here, it won't be for Chinese

v_rV3PGptB-sACVFZY60dg.text: What a hidden gem!  I have been searching for a good asian restaurant in Phoenix/Scottsdale for some time now...and the search is over.  First, don't let the location scare you off.  The original location is certainly not in the best spot, next to a planned parenthood, but once you are inside the asian decor makes you forget where you are.  The portions are absolutely huge.  One entree is more than enough for two people.    To start, my fiance and I had the Pho Tae Bo Vein.  This Pho hangs with the best.  A great selection of garnishments accompanies the soup.  Great taste and an entree in and of itself.  I will come back just for this dish.  We then ordered the Kang Keo Wan and the Chiang Mai Noodles.  These dishes taste essentially the same.  However, the Chiang Mai Noodles was had a little sweeter taste to it.  Overall, the spices were great, not to spicy but enough to have flavor.  Try this place out!

mU0Y0CHkIXM5RGs8nyMk0g.text: This place is really growing on me.  I always drove by it, but never stopped for some reason.  It's a mile further from my house than Noodles Ranch (highly recommended) and is tucked in a sort of non-descript plaza that I never go to.  The first time I ate there I ordered the Szechwan Style Bean Curd, which was good, but did not get me overly excited.  It was served with the soft tofu, rather than the crispy style that I prefer.  I waited a couple of months before going back.  I then inquired about subbing tofu for meat in dishes.  They will sub tofu in for anything and make it crispy.  Awesome.  I have had the Tangerine Tofu and Sesame Tofu now, both of which were very tasty.  Totties will not be incorpated into my rotation of restaurants.  I look forward to working my way through the menu.    The interior of the place is very nicely done as well.  I never would have suspected that such a nice place lay inside from the look of the plaza interior.

aLRirQUvVhel9vC9DIbFgA.text: Wow, I am very surprised by some of the reviews here. I have eaten here about 6 times now and it has always been fantastic! We even had a large party of over 20 people for a birthday party of very picky, picky eaters and all was great. We have tried various dishes here and they are all delish. Their chicken curry is one of the best in town! ( But spicy so beware) They also have a good Tangerine Beef dish. Sorry can't  comment on the Sushi since I think Sushi is disgusting! The Ice cream is a nice ending to your meal too.  The service is wonderful here!  We are alway treated like family.

1fVakcbz25Pql-8HyCDQ3A.text: I absolutely love their spicy seafood noodle soup! It's amazing and everyone I know that have tried it agree! If you like a good Thai spice this is the soup. Level of spices 1-7
